sentence: Partly in response to the chronic underfunding of African-American education in the South, the Rosenwald Fund began to finance the construction of what has been called Rosenwald schools.

sentence: The continuation of racial discrimination and lynching, the agricultural depression and the failure of cotton crops due to the infestation of ploughs has led tens of thousands of African Americans from rural areas of Alabama and other states to seek opportunities in the cities of the north and west in the first decades of the 20th century as part of the Great Migration out of the South.

sentence: The population of Ketchikan, for example, fluctuates considerably over many days – up to four large cruise ships can moor at the same time.

name: alaska
sentence: Cities not served by road, sea or river can only be reached by air, foot, dog sled or snow machine, representing Alaska's highly developed bush air services, a novelty in Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: Anchorage and, to a lesser extent, Fairbanks are served by many large airlines.

name: alaska
sentence: Due to limited access to the road, air transport remains the most efficient form of transport within and outside the State.

name: alaska
sentence: Anchorage recently completed extensive renovation and construction work at Ted Stevens Anchorage International Airport to accommodate the upsurge in tourism (in 2012-13, Alaska welcomed nearly two million visitors).

name: alaska
sentence: Regular flights to most commercially viable villages and cities in the state are difficult to provide, so they are heavily subsidized by the federal government as part of the essential air services program.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska Airlines is the only major airline to offer jet flights in the state (sometimes in combination with Boeing 737-400 cargo and passengers) from Anchorage and Fairbanks to regional centres such as Bethel, Nome, Kotzebue, Dillingham, Kodiak and other large communities, as well as major communities in the southeast and the Alaska Peninsula.

name: alaska
sentence: Most of the remaining commercial flights come from small regional suburban companies such as Ravn Alaska, PenAir and Frontier Flying Service.

name: alaska
sentence: Smaller towns and villages have to rely on regular or chartered bush flights using general aviation aircraft such as the Cessna Caravan, the most popular aircraft in use in the state.

name: alaska
sentence: Much of this service can be attributed to Alaska's mail bypass program, which subsidizes bulk mail delivery to rural Alaskan communities.

name: alaska
sentence: The program requires that 70% of this subsidy be paid to carriers that provide passenger transportation services to communities.

name: alaska
sentence: Many communities have small air taxi services.

name: alaska
sentence: These operations are the result of demand for personalized transportation to remote areas.

name: alaska
sentence: Perhaps the most quintessence aircraft in Alaska is the bush seaplane.

name: alaska
sentence: The world's busiest seaplane base is Lake Hood, located next to Ted Stevens Anchorage International Airport, where flights to remote villages without airstrips carry passengers, freight and many items from stores and warehouse clubs.

name: alaska
sentence: In 2006, Alaska had the largest number of pilots per capita in all U.S. states.

name: alaska
sentence: Another means of transportation from Alaska is the dog sled.

name: alaska
sentence: In modern times (i.e. at any time after the mid-1920s), dog mushing is more a sport than a means of transportation.

name: alaska
sentence: Various races are organized around the state, but the best known is the Iditarod sled dog race, a trail of 1,150 miles (1,850 km) from Anchorage to Nome (although the distance varies from year to year, the official distance is set at 1,049 miles or 1,688 km).

name: alaska
sentence: The race commemorates the famous 1925 serum race in Nome in which moshers and dogs like Togo and Balto took medicines very necessary to the diphtheria community of Nome when all the other means of transport had failed.

name: alaska
sentence: Mushers from all over the world come to Anchorage every March to fight for money, prizes and prestige.

name: alaska
sentence: The "Serum Run" is another sled dog race that follows more precisely the route of the famous relay of 1925, starting from the community of Nenana (southwest of Fairbanks) in Nome.

name: alaska
sentence: In areas not served by road or rail, primary transportation in summer is by off-road vehicle and winter by snowmobile or "snow machine", as is commonly known in Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: The Internet and other data transport systems in Alaska are largely provided by the two major telecommunications companies: GCI and Alaska Communications.

sentence: In January 2011, it was reported that a $1 billion project to link Asia and the rural areas of Alaska was planned, partly supported by $350 million in stimulus from the federal government.

name: alaska
sentence: Like all other American states, Alaska is governed as a republic, with three branches of government: an executive power composed of the Governor of Alaska and his appointed persons who are head of executive departments; a legislative power composed of the House of Representatives of Alaska and Senators of Alaska; and a judicial power composed of the Supreme Court of Alaska and the lower courts.

name: alaska
sentence: The state of Alaska employs approximately 16,000 people throughout the state.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaska Legislative Assembly consists of a 40-member House of Representatives and a 20-member Senate.

name: alaska
sentence: Senators have a four-year term and members of the House two.

name: alaska
sentence: The Governor of Alaska is appointed for four years.

name: alaska
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor shall appear separately from the Governor in the primaries, but in the general election the candidate for governorship and the candidate for lieutenant governor shall stand together on the same note.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaskan judicial system has four levels: the Alaskan Supreme Court, the Alaskan Court of Appeal, the Superior Courts and the District Courts.

name: alaska
sentence: Higher and district courts are courts of first instance.

name: alaska
sentence: Superior courts are courts of general jurisdiction, while district courts only deal with certain types of cases, including criminal cases and civil cases of up to $100,000.

name: alaska
sentence: The Supreme Court and the Court of Appeal are courts of appeal.

name: alaska
sentence: The Court of Appeal is required to hear appeals from certain decisions of the lower courts, including those concerning criminal prosecution, juvenile delinquency and habeas corpus.

name: alaska
sentence: The Supreme Court hears civil appeals and may, at its discretion, hear criminal appeals.

name: alaska
sentence: Although in its early years of the state of Alaska was a democratic state, since the early 1970s it has been characterized as Republican-leaning.

name: alaska
sentence: Local political communities have often worked on issues related to land use planning, fisheries, tourism and individual rights.

name: alaska
sentence: Aboriginal people in Alaska, although organized in and around their communities, are active in Aboriginal societies.

name: alaska
sentence: They have been given ownership over vast tracts of land, which requires stewardship.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska was previously the only state in which possession of one ounce or less of marijuana in its home was fully legal under state law, although federal law remains in force.

name: alaska
sentence: The state has an independence movement in favour of a United States secession vote with the Alaska Independence Party.

name: alaska
sentence: Six Republicans and four Democrats served as governor of Alaska.

name: alaska

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska's legal marijuana election initiative came into effect on February 24, 2015, placing Alaska alongside Colorado and Washington as the first three states in the United States where recreational marijuana is legal.

sentence: The new law means that people over the age of 21 can consume small amounts of pot.

name: alaska
sentence: The first legal marijuana shop opened in Valdez in October 2016.

name: alaska
sentence: To finance state government operations, Alaska relies primarily on oil revenues and federal subsidies.

name: alaska
sentence: This allows it to have the lowest individual tax burden in the United States.

name: alaska
sentence: It is one of the five states that do not have sales taxes, one of the seven states that do not have personal income taxes, and, together with New Hampshire, one of the two states that do not.

name: alaska
sentence: The Tax Division of the Department of Revenue reports regularly on government revenue sources.

name: alaska
sentence: The Department also publishes an annual summary of its activities, including new state laws that have a direct impact on the tax division.

name: alaska
sentence: In 2014, the Tax Foundation ranked Alaska as the fourth most business-friendly tax policy, behind only Wyoming, South Dakota and Nevada.

name: alaska
sentence: Although Alaska does not have a state sales tax, 89 municipalities collect a local sales tax of 1.0-7.5 per cent, generally between 3 and 5 per cent.

name: alaska
sentence: Other local taxes collected include taxes on raw fish, hotel taxes, motel and bed and breakfast taxes, departure taxes, alcohol and tobacco taxes, gambling taxes, tire taxes and fuel transfer taxes.

name: alaska
sentence: A portion of revenues from certain state taxes and licence fees (e.g., oil, aviation fuel, telephone cooperation) are shared with Alaskan municipalities.

name: alaska
sentence: The fall in oil prices after the fracturing boom in the early 2010s decimated Alaska's Treasury, which has always received about 85 per cent of its revenues from taxes and duties imposed on oil and gas companies.

name: alaska
sentence: The Government of the State had to cut its budget considerably and reduced its budget deficit from more than $2 billion in 2016 to less than $500 million in 2018.

name: alaska
sentence: In 2020, the state of Alaska's budget was $4.8 billion, while projected government revenues were only $4.5 billion.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska regularly supports Republicans in presidential elections and has done so since the establishment of the State.

sentence: The Republicans won the votes of the state electoral college in all but one of the elections, in which they took part (1964).

name: alaska
sentence: No state has voted less times for a candidate for the democratic presidency.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska was led by Democratic candidate Lyndon B. Johnson in his shaken election in 1964, while the 1960 and 1968 elections were closed.

name: alaska
sentence: Since 1972, however, Republicans have raised the state to large margins.

sentence: In 2008, Republican John McCain beat Democratic Barack Obama in Alaska, 59.49 per cent to 37.83 per cent.

sentence: McCain's companion was Sarah Palin, Governor of the State, and the first Alaskan on a major party ticket.

name: alaska
sentence: Obama once again lost Alaska in 2012, but won 40% of the state's votes in this election, making it the first democrat to do so since 1968.

sentence: The district of Matanuska-Susitna, the majority of the Fairbanks (including the North Pole and the military base), and the Southern Anchorage generally have the highest republican representation.

sentence: In the 2020 electoral cycle, Alaskan voters approved the voting measure 2.

name: alaska
sentence: The measure was voted by a margin of 1.1%, or about 4,000 votes.

name: alaska
sentence: Supporters of the measure argue that it will reduce "black money" in the Alaskan elections by requiring anyone who gives more than $2,000 to a campaign to disclose the true source of these contributions and all intermediaries.

name: alaska
sentence: The measure also establishes non-partisan general primary elections for state-wide elections (as in the state of Washington and California) and classified elective voting (as in Maine).

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska is not divided into counties, like most other American states, but is divided into boroughs.

name: alaska
sentence: Many of the most densely populated parts of the state are in the 16 Alaskan boroughs, which operate in roughly the same way as the counties of other states.

name: alaska
sentence: However, unlike equivalent counties in the other 49 states, boroughs do not cover the entire area of the state.

name: alaska
sentence: The region that is not part of the borough is referred to as an unorganized borough.

name: alaska
sentence: The unorganized borough does not have a single government, but the United States Census Bureau, in collaboration with the state, has divided the unorganized borough into 11 census areas for statistical analysis and presentation purposes only.

name: alaska
sentence: A registration district is a public record management mechanism in Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: The State is divided into 34 registration districts which are centrally administered by a State recorder.

name: alaska
sentence: All registration districts use the same acceptance criteria, fee schedule, etc., to accept documents in the public file.

name: alaska
sentence: While many U.S. states use a three-tier system of decentralization, state, county and township, most Alaskan states use only two levels, state and borough.

name: alaska
sentence: Due to the low population density, most of the land is in the informal district.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona (listen) ARR-iz-OH-n

name: arizona
sentence: It is also part of the Western and Mountain states.

name: arizona
sentence: It is the 6th largest and the 14th most populous of the 50 states.

name: arizona
sentence: Its capital and largest city is Phoenix.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona shares the Four Corners region with Utah, Colorado and New Mexico; its other neighbouring states are Nevada and California to the west and the Mexican states of Sonora and Lower California to the south and south-west.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is the 48th state and the last of the contiguous states to be admitted into the Union, obtaining state status on 14 February 1912.

name: arizona
sentence: Historically part of the territory of Alta California in New Spain, it was part of independent Mexico in 1821.

name: arizona
sentence: After being defeated during the war between Mexico and America, Mexico ceded much of that territory to the United States in 1848.

name: arizona
sentence: The southernmost part of the State was acquired in 1853 through the purchase of Gadsden.

name: arizona
sentence: Southern Arizona is known for its desert climate, with very warm summers and mild winters.

name: arizona
sentence: Northern Arizona is home to pine, Douglas-fir and spruce forests; the Colorado Plateau; mountain ranges (such as the San Francisco Mountains); and large deep canyons, with much more moderate summer temperatures and significant winter snowfall.

name: arizona
sentence: There are ski resorts in Flagstaff, Alpine and Tucson.

name: arizona
sentence: In addition to the internationally known Grand Canyon National Park, which is one of the seven natural wonders of the world, there are several national forests, national parks and national monuments.

name: arizona
sentence: About one-quarter of the state is made up of Indian reserves that serve as residences for 27 American Aboriginal tribes recognized by the federal government, including the Navajo Nation, the largest state and the United States, with more than 300,000 citizens.

name: arizona
sentence: Although federal law gave American citizenship to all Amerindians (and thus the right to vote) in 1924, Arizona excluded persons living on reserves in the state from voting until the Supreme Court of the State ruled in favour of Amerindian applicants in Harrison v. Laveen (1948).

name: arizona
sentence: The name of the state seems to come from an earlier Spanish name, Arizonac, derived from the name of O'odham al-Odham, that is, "small spring", which initially applied only to an area near the silver mining camp of Planchas de Plata, Sonora.

sentence: The misconception that the name of the state comes from the so-called Spanish term Árida Zona ("arid zone") is considered a case of popular etymology.

sentence: When Mexico gained independence from the Kingdom of Spain and its Spanish Empire in 1821, what is now Arizona became part of its territory of Nueva California, ("New California"), also known as Alta California ("Superior California").

name: california

name: california
sentence: California's executive branch consists of the Governor and seven other elected constitutional officers: Lieutenant Governor, Attorney General, Secretary of State, State Controller, Treasurer of State, Insurance Commissioner and Superintendent of State of Public Education.

name: california
sentence: The California legal system is explicitly based on English common law (as is the case for all other states except Louisiana) but has some features of Spanish civil law, such as community property.

sentence: California has an idiosyncratic political culture compared to the rest of the country, and is sometimes regarded as a more trending one.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado (other variants) is a state in the western United States that encompasses most of the southern Rocky Mountains as well as the northeastern part of the Colorado Plateau and the western boundary of the Great Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: It is the 8th largest and 21st most populous state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's population is estimated at 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.5% since the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The area has been inhabited by Native Americans for more than 13,000 years, the Lindenmeier site containing artifacts dating from approximately 9200 B.C. to 1000 B.C.; the eastern edge of the Rocky Mountains has been an important migration route for the first peoples that have spread throughout the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The state was named for the Colorado River, which the first Spanish explorers named the Río Colorado ("Red River") for the red silt that the river carried from the mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The territory of Colorado was organized on February 28, 1861, and on August 1, 1876, US President Ulysses S. Grant signed the Proclamation 230 admitting Colorado to the Union as the 38th state.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is nicknamed the "State of the Centennial" because it became a state a century after the signing of the United States Declaration of Independence.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is bordered by Wyoming in the north, Nebraska in the northeast, Kansas in the east, Oklahoma in the southeast, New Mexico in the south, Utah in the west and Arizona in the southwest at the Four Corners.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its rich landscape of mountains, forests, high plains, mesas, canyons, plateaus, rivers and desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is one of the mountain states of the United States and is part of the western and southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is the capital of Colorado and the most populated city.

name: colorado
sentence: State residents are known as Coloradans, although the old term "Coloradoan" is sometimes used.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is a relatively wealthy state, ranking 8th in household income in 2016 and 11th in per capita income in 2010.

name: colorado
sentence: The main components of the economy include government and defence, mining, agriculture, tourism and more and more other types of manufacturing.

name: colorado
sentence: With rising temperatures and reduced water availability, Colorado's agricultural, forestry and tourism economies are expected to be heavily affected by climate change.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is remarkable for its diverse geography, which includes alpine mountains, high plains, deserts with huge sand dunes, and deep canyons.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1861, the United States Congress defined the boundaries of the new territory of Colorado exclusively by lines of latitude and longitude, ranging from 37°N to 41°N latitude, and from 102°02′48′′W to 109°02′48′′W longitude (25°W to 32°W of the Washington Meridian).

name: colorado
sentence: After 159 years of government investigations, Colorado's borders are now officially defined by 697 bounds and 697 straight lines of demarcation.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado, Wyoming and Utah are the only states to have their borders defined solely by straight boundaries without natural characteristics.

name: colorado
sentence: The southwest corner of Colorado is the Four Corners Monument at 36°59′56′′N, 109°2′43′′W.

name: colorado
sentence: The Four Corners Monument, located at the place where Colorado, New Mexico, Arizona and Utah meet, is the only place in the United States where four states meet.

name: colorado
sentence: To the west of the Great Plains of Colorado rises the east slope of the Rocky Mountains.

sentence: The remarkable peaks of the Rocky Mountains include Long Peak, Mount Evans, Pikes Peak and Spanish peaks near Walsenburg, in southern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This area flows east and south-east through either the Mississippi River or the Rio Grande in the Gulf of Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The Rocky Mountains in Colorado contain 53 actual peaks with a total of 58 that are 14,000 feet (4,267 m) or higher above sea level, known as fourteen.

name: colorado
sentence: These mountains are largely covered with trees such as conifers and asphalts to the tree line, at an altitude of approximately 12,000 feet (3,658 m) in southern Colorado at approximately 10,500 feet (3,200 m) in northern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Above this tree line grows only alpine vegetation.

name: colorado
sentence: Only small parts of the Colorado Rockies are covered with snow all year round.

sentence: Much of the alpine snow melts around mid-August, with the exception of a few snowy peaks and a few small glaciers.

sentence: The Colorado Mineral Belt, which extends from the San Juan Mountains in the southwest to Boulder and Central City in the front, contains most of Colorado's historic gold and silver mining districts.

name: colorado
sentence: Mount Elbert is the highest peak in the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The top 30 major peaks of the North American Rockies are all in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The summit of Mount Elbert at an altitude of 14,440 feet (4,401.2 m) in Lake County is the highest point in Colorado and the Rocky Mountains of North America.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is the only U.S. state entirely above 1000 metres of altitude.

name: colorado
sentence: The point where the Arikaree River flows from Yuma County, Colorado, and Cheyenne County, Kansas, is the lowest point in Colorado at an altitude of 3,317 feet (1,011 m).

sentence: This point, which is the highest altitude point of any state, is higher than the altitude points of 18 states and the District of Columbia.

name: colorado
sentence: A little less than half of Colorado is flat and hilly.

sentence: The Colorado Plains are mostly prairies, but also include deciduous forests, mounds and canyons.

sentence: Precipitation averages 15 to 25 inches (380 to 640 mm) per year.

sentence: Currently, eastern Colorado is mainly agricultural land and routes, as well as small villages and agricultural towns.

sentence: Corn, wheat, hay, soybeans and oats are typical crops.

sentence: Most villages and towns in this region have both a water tower and a grain elevator.

sentence: Irrigation water is available both on the surface and in groundwater.

name: colorado

sentence: Approximately 70% of Colorado's population lives along the eastern limit of the Rocky Mountains in the Front Range urban corridor between Cheyenne, Wyoming and Pueblo, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This area is partly protected from the dominant storms that blow from the Pacific Ocean region by the upper Rocky Mountains in the middle of Colorado.

sentence: The "Front Chain" includes Denver, Boulder, Fort Collins, Loveland, Castle Rock, Colorado Springs, Pueblo, Greeley and other townships and municipalities in the in-between.

name: colorado

sentence: Colorado's desert lands are located in and around areas such as Pueblo, Canon City, Florence, Grand Sand Dunes National Park and Reserve, San Luis Valley, Cortez, Canyon of the Ancients National Monument, Hovenweep National Monument, Ute Mountain, Delta, Grand Junction, Colorado National Monument, and other areas surrounding the Uncomahgre Plateau and Uncomahgre National Forest.

sentence: As a general rule, an increase in altitude leads to a decrease in temperature and an increase in precipitation.

sentence: Southwestern and southern Colorado are a complex mix of desert and mountainous areas.

sentence: The difference between the highs of the days and the lows of the nights can be considerable since the heat dissipates in the space during the clear nights, since the thermal radiation is not trapped by the clouds.

name: colorado
sentence: The Front Range urban corridor, home to most of Colorado's population, is in a shadow of precipitation due to its presence on the lee side of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In summer, this region may have several days above 95°F (35°C) and often 100°F (38°C).

name: colorado
sentence: In the plains, winter hollows usually range from 25 to -10°F (−4 to -23°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 75% of precipitation falls during the growing season, from April to September, but this region is highly prone to drought.

name: colorado
sentence: Most precipitation comes from thunderstorms, which can be severe, and major snowstorms that occur in winter and early spring.

name: colorado
sentence: Otherwise, winters tend to be more or less dry and cold.

name: colorado
sentence: In most of the region, Mars is the most snowy month.

name: colorado
sentence: April and May are normally the wettest months, while April is the wettest month overall.

name: colorado
sentence: The cities of Front Range closer to the mountains tend to be warmer in winter due to the Chinook wind that warms the area, sometimes bringing temperatures of 70°F (21°C) or higher in winter.

name: colorado
sentence: The mean July temperature is 55°F (13°C) in the morning and 90°F (32°C) in the afternoon.

name: colorado
sentence: The mean January temperature is 18°F (−8°C) in the morning and 48°F (9°C) in the afternoon, although the variations between consecutive days may be 40°F (20°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Just west of the plains and in the foothills, there is a wide variety of climate types.

name: colorado
sentence: Locations a few kilometres apart may experience a completely different time depending on the topography.

name: colorado
sentence: Most valleys have a semi-arid climate that is no different from the eastern plains, which moves to an alpine climate at the highest altitudes.

name: colorado
sentence: Microclimates also exist in local areas that cover almost the full range of climates, including subtropical highlands (Cfb/Cwb), wet subtropicals (Cfa), wet continentals (Dfa/Dfb), Mediterraneans (Csa/Csb) and subarctics (Dfc).

name: colorado
sentence: Extreme climate change is common in Colorado, although a significant part of the extreme weather conditions occur in the least populated areas of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Thunderstorms are common east of the continental ditch in spring and summer, but are usually short.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is a common view in the mountains east of Divide and across the eastern plains, especially the northeastern part of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is the most commonly reported serious weather hazard for the warm season and occasionally causes human injury, as well as significant material damage.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are subject to some of the largest hailstorms in North America.

name: colorado
sentence: Examples include the violent hailstorms that struck Denver on July 11, 1990 and May 8, 2017, the latter being the most costly in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are part of the extreme west of the Tornado gangway; some harmful tornadoes on the eastern plains include the 1990 Limon F3 tornado and the Windsor EF3 tornado, which devastated the small town in 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: Portions of the eastern plains see particularly frequent tornadoes, whether from mesocyclones in supercell storms or from less intense lands, such as the Denver Convergence Vorticity Zone (DCVZ).

name: colorado
sentence: The plains are also exposed to occasional flooding and particularly severe flash floods, which are caused by both thunderstorms and the rapid melting of snow in the mountains in warm weather.

name: colorado
sentence: Notable examples include the Denver flood in 1965, the Big Thompson flood in 1976 and the Colorado flood in 2013.

name: colorado
sentence: Hot weather is common in the summers in Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The city's record in 1901 for consecutive days above 90°F (32°C) was broken in the summer of 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: The new record of 24 consecutive days surpassed the previous record of almost a week.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of Colorado is very dry, with the average condition of only 17 inches (430 millimetres) of precipitation per year on a state-wide basis.

name: colorado
sentence: The state rarely experiences a time when part of it is not to some extent drought.

name: colorado
sentence: The lack of precipitation contributes to the severity of forest fires in the state, such as the Hayman fire in 2002.

name: colorado
sentence: Other notable fires include the 2010 Fourmile Canyon Fire, the Waldo Canyon Fire and the June 2012 High Park Fire, and the June 2013 Black Forest Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Even these fires were overtaken by the pine mulch fire, the Cameron Peak fire, and the Eastern Troublefire in 2020, which are the three largest fires in Colorado history (see Colorado Forest Fires in 2020).

name: colorado
sentence: However, some of Colorado's mountainous regions receive a large amount of moisture from winter snowfall.

name: colorado
sentence: The spring melt of these snows often causes large flows of water in the Yampa River, Colorado River, Rio Grande, Arkansas, North Platte River and South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: Water flowing from the Colorado Rocky Mountains is a very important source of water for farms, cities and cities in southwestern New Mexico, Arizona, Utah and Nevada, as well as for the Midwest, such as Nebraska and Kansas, and the southern states of Oklahoma and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: A significant amount of water is also diverted for use in California; sometimes (formerly naturally and regularly) water flows reach northern Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest ambient air temperature ever recorded in Colorado was 115°F (46.1°C) on July 20, 2019, at the John Martin Dam.

name: colorado
sentence: The lowest official air temperature was −61°F (−51.7°C) on 1 February 1985 at Maybell.

name: colorado
sentence: Despite its mountainous reliefs, Colorado is relatively calm from the seismic point of view.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. National Earthquake Information Centre is located in Golden.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 22, 2011, an earthquake of magnitude 5.3 occurred 14 km west and southwest of the city of Trinidad.

name: colorado
sentence: There were no casualties and only a small amount of damage was reported.

name: colorado
sentence: It was the second earthquake in Colorado's history.

name: colorado
sentence: An earthquake of magnitude 5.7 was recorded in 1973.

name: colorado
sentence: In the early morning of August 24, 2018, four minor earthquakes swept the state of Colorado from magnitude 2.9 to 4.3.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has recorded 525 earthquakes since 1973, with a majority of 2 to 3.5 earthquakes on the Richter scale.

name: colorado
sentence: The area that is now the state of Colorado has been inhabited by Native Americans for more than 13,000 years.

name: colorado
sentence: The Lindenmeier site in Larimer County contains artifacts dating from approximately 11200 B.C. to 3000 B.C.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern end of the Rockies was an important migratory route that was important for the spread of the first peoples in the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The ancient Pueblo people lived in the valleys and mesas of the Colorado plateau.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute Nation has inhabited the valleys of the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Western Rocky Mountains, even east of the Front Range these days.

name: colorado
sentence: The Apaches and the Comanches also lived in the eastern and southeastern parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Sometimes the Arapaho Nation and the Cheyenne Nation moved westward to hunt across the High Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Spanish Empire claimed Colorado as part of its province of New Mexico before American involvement in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States acquired a land claim east of the Rocky Mountains with the purchase of Louisiana in France in 1803.

name: colorado
sentence: This American claim was in conflict with Spain's claim to the upper Arkansas basin as the exclusive commercial zone of its colony of Santa Fé de Nuevo México.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1806, Zebulon Pike led an American Army reconnaissance expedition to the disputed area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Pike and his men were arrested by Spanish horsemen in the San Luis Valley the following February, taken to Chihuahua and expelled from Mexico the following July.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States has waived its rights to all lands south and west of Arkansas and south of the 42nd parallel north and west of the 100th meridian to the west as part of the purchase of Florida from Spain with the Adams-Onís Treaty of 1819.

name: colorado
sentence: The Treaty entered into force on 22 February 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Having established its border with Spain, the United States admitted the south-eastern part of the territory of Missouri to the Union as the state of Missouri on 10 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: The rest of Missouri territory, including what will become northeastern Colorado, becomes unorganized territory and will remain so for 33 years on the issue of slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: After 11 years of war, Spain finally recognized Mexico's independence with the Treaty of Cordoba signed on August 24, 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico finally ratified the Treaty of Adams-On in 1831.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texian revolt of 1835–36 fomented a dispute between the United States and Mexico that finally broke out in the war between Mexico and America in 1846.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico ceded its northern territory to the United States with the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo at the end of the war in 1848.

name: colorado
sentence: Most American settlers travelling west to Oregon, the new California gold fields, or the new Mormon colonies of Deseret State in the Salt Lake Valley, avoided the rugged southern rocky mountains, and instead followed the North Platte River and the Sweetwater River to the South Pass (Wyoming), the lowest passage of the continental divide between the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Central Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1849, the Mormons of the Salt Lake Valley organized the extralegal state of Deseret, claiming the entire Great Basin and all the lands drained by the Green, Grand and Colorado rivers.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. federal government totally refused to recognize the new Mormon government, because it was theocratic and sanctioned plural marriage.

name: colorado
sentence: Instead, the 1850 compromise divided the Mexican Cessation and the northwestern claims of Texas into a new state and two new territories, the state of California, the territory of New Mexico and the territory of Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: On 9 April 1851, American Mexican settlers from the Taos region established the village of San Luis and then in the New Mexico Territory, later becoming the first permanent Euro-American colony in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1854, Senator Stephen A. Douglas persuaded the United States Congress to divide the unorganized territory east of the Continental Divide into two new organized territories, Kansas Territory and Nebraska Territory, and an unorganized southern region known as Indian Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Each new territory had to decide the fate of slavery within its borders, but this compromise only fueled animosity between the free soil and the pro-slavery factions.

name: colorado
sentence: Gold seekers organized the Provisional Government of Jefferson's Territory on 24 August 1859, but this new territory did not obtain the approval of the United States Congress in the debate on slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: The election of Abraham Lincoln as President of the United States on 6 November 1860 resulted in the secession of nine southern slave states and the threat of civil war between states.

name: colorado
sentence: In an effort to increase the political power of the states of the Union, the Republican-dominated Congress quickly admitted the eastern part of Kansas territory to the Union as a free state of Kansas on 29 January 1861, leaving the western part of Kansas territory and its gold mining areas as an unorganized territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Thirty days later, on February 28, 1861, the outgoing president of the United States, James Buchanan, signed an act of convention organizing the free territory of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The initial limits for Colorado remain unchanged, except for changes to government surveys.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado name was chosen because it was commonly believed that the Colorado River was native to the Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1776, the Spanish priest Silvestre Vélez de Escalante reported that the Amerindians of the area knew the river as Rio Colorado for the red-brown silt that the river bore mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1859, a topographical expedition of the U.S. Army led by Captain John Maccomb established the confluence of the Green River with the Grand River in what is now Canyonlands National Park in Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: The Macorb party has designated the confluence as the source of the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 12, 1861, South Carolina artillery opened fire on Fort Sumter to launch the American civil war.

name: colorado
sentence: While many gold researchers appreciated Confederation, the vast majority of them remained fiercely loyal to the cause of the Union.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1862, a Texas cavalry force invaded the territory of New Mexico and captured Santa Fe on 10 March.

name: colorado
sentence: The purpose of this Western campaign was to seize or disrupt the gold fields of Colorado and California and seize the ports of the Pacific Ocean for Confederation.

name: colorado
sentence: A force organized in haste by Colorado volunteers moved from Denver City, Colorado Territory, to Col Glorieta, New Mexico Territory, to try to block the Texans.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 28, New Mexico's Coloradans and local volunteers stopped the Texans at the battle of Col Glorieta, destroyed their cannons and fuel wagons, and dispersed 500 of their horses and mules.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texans were forced to retreat to Santa Fe.

name: colorado
sentence: Having lost the food of their campaign and found little support for New Mexico, the Texans abandoned Santa Fe and returned to San Antonio in defeat.

name: colorado
sentence: The Confederation has made no further attempt to seize the southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1864, the Governor of the Territory John Evans appointed the Reverend John Chivington Colonel of Colorado Volunteers with orders to protect the white settlers of the Cheyenne and Arapaho warriors accused of stealing cattle.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Chivington ordered his men to attack a band of Cheyenne and Arapaho camped along Sand Creek.

name: colorado
sentence: Chivington reported that his troops had killed more than 500 warriors.

name: colorado
sentence: The militia returned to Denver City in triumph, but several officers reported that the so-called battle was a flagrant massacre of Indians at peace, that most of the dead were women and children, and that the bodies of the dead had been hideously mutilated and desecrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Army investigations have condemned the action and new President Andrew Johnson has asked Governor Evans for his resignation, but none of the perpetrators has ever been punished.

name: colorado
sentence: This event is now known as the Sand Creek Massacre.

name: colorado
sentence: In the middle and after the civil war, many discouraged prospectors returned home, but some stayed and developed mines, mills, farms, ranches, roads and towns in Colorado territory.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 14, 1864, James Huff discovered the silver near the Col de l'Argentine, the first of a multitude of silver strikes.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1867, the Union Pacific Railway laid its tracks westward to Weir, now Julesburg, in the northeast corner of the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pacific Union established a link with the Central Pacific Railway at the Promontory Summit in Utah on May 10, 1869, to form the first transcontinental railway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver Pacific railway reached Denver in June the following year, and the Kansas Pacific arrived two months later to forge the second line across the continent.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1872, rich veins of silver were discovered in the San Juan Mountains on the Ute Indian Reserve in southwestern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Utes were removed from San Juan the following year.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 3, 1875, the United States Congress passed enabling legislation specifying the conditions for the territory of Colorado to become a state.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 1, 1876 (four weeks after the United States Centennial), US President Ulysse S. Grant signed a proclamation in which he admitted Colorado to the Union as 38th State and earned it the name of "State of the Centennial".

name: colorado
sentence: The discovery of a large silver lode near Leadville in 1878 triggered the Colorado silver boom.

name: colorado
sentence: The Sherman Silver Purchase Act of 1890 reinvigorated silver mining, and the latest Colorado gold strike, but the most important one, at Cripple Creek a few months later, attracted a new generation of gold researchers.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado women were granted the right to vote on 7 November 1893, making Colorado the second state to grant universal suffrage and the first by popular vote (men of Colorado).

name: colorado
sentence: The repeal of the Sherman Silver Buy Act in 1893 led to a horrific collapse of Colorado's mining and agricultural economy, but the state recovered slowly and steadily.

name: colorado
sentence: Between the 1880s and 1930s, the Denver floriculture industry became a major industry in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This period is known locally as the gold rush of the carnations.

name: colorado
sentence: The poor working conditions and discontent of the miners caused several major clashes between the strikers and the Colorado National Guard, including the Western Federation of Minors of 1903-1904 and the Colorado Coal War, including the Ludlow massacre, which killed a dozen women and children.

name: colorado
sentence: The coal war of 1913-1914 and the streetcar strike of Denver in 1920 brought in federal troops to put an end to the violence.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1927, the Columbine mine massacre resulted in six strikers who died as a result of a confrontation with the Colorado Rangers.

name: colorado
sentence: It is estimated that more than 5,000 miners from Colorado, many immigrants, have died in accidents since records were formally collected following an accident in Crested Butte that killed 59 in 1884.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado became the first Western state to host an important political assembly when the Democratic Party met in Denver in 1908.

name: colorado
sentence: At the 1930 U.S. census, Colorado's population was first over a million residents.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado suffered greatly from the Great Depression and Dust Bowl of the 1930s, but a major wave of immigration after the Second World War boosted Colorado's fortune.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism has become a pillar of the national economy, and high technology has become an important economic driver.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimated that Colorado's population exceeded five million in 2009.

name: colorado
sentence: Three US Navy warships were named the USColorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The first USColorado was named for the Colorado River and served in the civil war and later in the Asian squadron, where he was attacked during the Korean expedition of 1871.

name: colorado
sentence: The last two ships were named in honour of the state, including the USColorado warship that served during the Second World War in the Pacific from 1941.

name: colorado
sentence: At the time of the attack on Pearl Harbor, this USColorado was located at the naval base in San Diego, Calif.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 11, 1957, a plutonium fire occurred at the Rocky Flats plant, resulting in significant plutonium contamination in the surrounding populated areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Since its disappearance by trapping and poisoning the Colorado grey wolf (Canis lupus) in the 1930s, a pack of wolves has recolonized Moffat County, Colorado in northwestern Colorado in 2019.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Colorado's population was 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.51 per cent since the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The most populous city and capital in Colorado is Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Greater Denver metropolitan area, with an estimated population of 3,515,374 in 2017, is considered the largest metropolitan area in the state and lies within the Front Range urban corridor, which has about five million inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest increases are expected in the Front Range urban corridor, particularly in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The fastest growing counties are Douglas and Weld.

name: colorado
sentence: The population centre of Colorado is located just north of the village of Critchell in Jefferson County.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2010 U.S. Census, Colorado's population was 5,029,196.

name: colorado
sentence: The racial composition of the population of the State is as follows:

name: colorado
sentence: Hispanic and Latin American peoples, regardless of race, accounted for 20.7 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, Colorado's main ancestry groups are German (22%), including Swiss and Austrian, Mexican (18%), Irish (12%) and English (12%).

name: colorado
sentence: People of German origin are particularly numerous in the Front Range, in the Rocky Mountains (Central West Counts) and in the eastern/high plains areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a large proportion of Hispanic citizens, mainly Mexican-American, in Metropolitan Denver, Colorado Springs, as well as in the small towns of Greeley and Pueblo, and elsewhere.

name: colorado
sentence: The south, south-west and south-east of Colorado have a large number of hispanos, descendants of the first Spanish colonial settlers.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1940, the Census Bureau reported that the Colorado population was 8.2% Hispanic and 90.3% non-Hispanic white.

name: colorado
sentence: In recent decades, the Hispanic population of Colorado has continued to grow rapidly.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2019, Hispanics accounted for 22% of Colorado's population, and non-Hispanic whites accounted for 70%.

name: colorado
sentence: English spoken in Colorado has many Spanish idioms.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado also has large African-American communities located in Denver, Montbello, Five Points, Whittier and many other areas of Eastern Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The state has a large number of Asian Americans of Mongolian origin, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, Southeast Asian and Japanese.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest population of Asian Americans is on the south and south-east side of Denver, as well as some on the south-west side of Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver metropolitan area is seen as more liberal and diverse than most states in terms of political issues and environmental concerns.

name: colorado
sentence: A total of 70,331 births occurred in Colorado in 2006.

name: colorado
sentence: (Average rate of 14.6 per thousand.)

name: colorado
sentence: In 2007, non-Hispanic whites were involved in 59.1% of all births.

name: colorado
sentence: About 14.06 per cent of these births involved a non-Hispanic white person and someone of a different race, most often with a couple including a Hispanic.

name: colorado
sentence: One birth where at least one Hispanic person was involved accounted for 43% of births in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: At the 2010 census, Colorado is the seventh largest percentage of Hispanics (20.7 per cent) in the United States behind New Mexico (46.3 per cent), California (37.6 per cent), Texas (37.6 per cent), Arizona (29.6 per cent), Nevada (26.5 per cent) and Florida (22.5 per cent).

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, the Hispanic population is estimated at 918,899 persons, or about 20 per cent of the total population of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has the fifth largest population of Mexican Americans, behind California, Texas, Arizona and Illinois.

name: colorado
sentence: In percentage, Colorado is the sixth highest among Mexicans, behind New Mexico, California, Texas, Arizona and Nevada.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2011, 46% of Colorado's population under one year of age were minorities, meaning that they had at least one non-Hispanic white parent.

name: colorado
sentence: Note: Births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnic origin and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2017, Colorado recorded the second lowest fertility rate in the United States, outside New England, after Oregon, at 1.63 children per woman.

name: colorado
sentence: The Title X Family Planning Program and Warren Buffett's intrauterine device grant contributed significantly to the decrease in the number of pregnancies.

name: colorado
sentence: Spanish is the second language spoken in Colorado, after English.

name: colorado
sentence: There is a native coloradan language still spoken in Colorado, Colorado River Numic (Ute).

name: colorado
sentence: The main religious affiliations of the Colorado population are 64% Christians, including 44% Protestants, 16% Roman Catholics, 3% Mormons and 1% Eastern Orthodox.

name: colorado
sentence: Other religious breakdowns are: 1% Jewish, 1% Muslim, 1% Buddhist and 4% other.

name: colorado
sentence: Non-affiliated individuals account for 29 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest denominations according to the number of adherents in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 811,630, the non-denominational evangelical Protestants with 229,981, and the Church of Jesus Christ of the last-day saints with 151,433.

name: colorado
sentence: According to several studies, Coloradans have the lowest obesity rates in any state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, 24 per cent of the population was considered obese from a medical point of view and, if it was the lowest in the country, it had dropped from 17 per cent in 2004.

name: colorado
sentence: According to a report published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, Colorado residents had a life expectancy of 80.21 years, the longest of all American states.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of film productions have been shot on site in Colorado, particularly in prominent westerns such as True Grit, The Searchers, Butch Cassidy and Sundance Kid.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of historic military forts, railways with trains still in service, ghost mining cities have been used and transformed for historical accuracy in well-known films.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of picturesque highways and mountain passes that have helped to highlight the free road in films such as Vanishing Point, Bingo and Starman.

name: colorado
sentence: Some of Colorado's monuments have been featured in films such as The Stanley Hotel in Dumb and Dumber and The Shining and the Sculptured House in Sleeper.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2015, Furious 7 was to film the driving sequences on Pikes Peak Highway in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Good Luck Charlie TV series was filmed in Denver, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Film and Television Bureau noted that more than 400 films were filmed in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of film festivals in Colorado, including Aspen Shortsfest, Boulder International Film Festival, Castle Rock Film Festival, Denver Film Festival, Festivus Film Festival (finished 2013), Mile High Horror Film Festival, Moondance International Film Festival, Mountainfilm in Telluride, Rocky Mountain Women's Film Festival and Telluride Film Festival.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its southwest and Rocky cuisine.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexican restaurants occupy a prominent place throughout the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado, was named America's Foodest Town 2010 by Bon Appétit.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, and Colorado in general, are home to a number of national food and beverage companies, leading restaurants and agricultural markets.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado also has more sommelier masters per capita than any other city, including San Francisco and New York.

name: colorado
sentence: The Food & Wine Classic is held annually in June in Aspen, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Aspen also has a reputation as the culinary capital of the Rocky Mountain region.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is known for its steak, but now has a varied culinary scene with many restaurants.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado wines include award-winning varieties that have attracted attention from outside the state.

name: colorado
sentence: With traditional Vitis vinifera grape-based wines, as well as cherries, peaches, plums and honey, Colorado wines have won national and international awards for their quality.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's wine-growing regions are home to the highest vineyards in the United States, with most of the state's viticulture being between 4,000 and 7,000 feet (1,219 and 2,134 m) above sea level.

name: colorado
sentence: The mountain climate guarantees warm summer days and cool nights.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to two designated U.S. wine-growing areas in the Grand Valley AVA and the Western Elks AVA, where most of the state's vineyards are located.

name: colorado
sentence: However, an increasing number of wineries are located along the Front chain.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, Wine Enthusiast Magazine named Grand Valley AVA of Colorado in Mesa County, Colorado, as one of ten wine travel destinations in the world.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to many nationally recognized microbreweries, including the New Belgium Brewing Company, Odell Brewing Company, Great Divide Brewing Company and Bristol Brewing Company.

name: colorado
sentence: The northern Colorado region, close to and between the cities of Denver, Boulder and Fort Collins, is known as the "Napa Valley of Beer" because of its high density of artisanal breweries.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is open to cannabis tourism (marijuana).

name: colorado
sentence: With the adoption of their 64th State Amendment in 2013, Colorado became the first state of the union to legalize the medicinal, industrial and recreational use of marijuana (2000).

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado marijuana industry sold $1.31 billion in marijuana in 2016 and $1.26 billion in the first three quarters of 2017.

name: colorado
sentence: The government generated tax revenues, fees and licenses of $194 million in 2016 on legal marijuana sales.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado regulates hemp in any part of the plant with less than 0.3% THC.

name: colorado
sentence: Amendment 64, adopted by voters in the 2012 general election, requires the State of Colorado legislature to enact laws governing the cultivation, processing and sale of recreational marijuana and industrial hemp.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 4, 2014, Senator Bill 14-184 on the oversight of the Colorado Industrial Hemp Program was introduced for the first time and was finally signed by Governor John Hickenlooper on May 31, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On 7 November 2000, 54% of Colorado voters adopted Amendment 20, which amends the Constitution of the State of Colorado to allow the medical use of marijuana.

name: colorado
sentence: Medical use of marijuana by a patient, within the following limits, is lawful:

name: colorado
sentence: Currently, Colorado has listed "eight medical conditions for which patients can use marijuana: cancer, glaucoma, HIV/AIDS, muscle spasms, seizures, severe pain, nausea and severe cachexia, or dramatic weight loss and muscle atrophy."

name: colorado
sentence: While governor, John Hickenlooper allocated about half of the 13 million dollars of the state "Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund" to medical research in Budget 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, the Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund was the "greatest potted silver pool in the state" and was used to fund programs, including research on paediatric applications to control the symptoms of autism.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 6, 2012, electors amended the state constitution to protect "personal use" of marijuana for adults, establishing a framework to regulate marijuana in a manner similar to alcohol.

name: colorado
sentence: The first recreational marijuana stores in Colorado, and by extension from the United States, opened on January 1, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has five major professional sports leagues, all based in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
