name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a constitutional form of democratic republican government with three branches: the executive, including an elected governor and lieutenant governor; the legislature, consisting of an elected bicameral general assembly; and the judiciary, the Supreme Court of Indiana, the Indiana Court of Appeal and circuit courts.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor of Indiana is the head of the executive of the state and has the power to manage the government as set out in the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor and the Lieutenant Governor are jointly elected for a four-year term, with government elections taking place at the same time as the American presidential elections (1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, etc.).

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may not serve more than two consecutive terms.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor works with the Indiana General Assembly and the Indiana Supreme Court to govern the state and has the power to adjust other branches.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may convene special sessions of the General Assembly and select and remove the leaders of almost all departments, councils and State commissions.

name: indiana
sentence: Other notable powers include the appeal to the Indiana Guard Reserve or the Indiana National Guard in case of emergency or disaster, the granting of pardons or commutation of the sentence of any criminal offender, except in cases of treason or indictment and possession of abundant legal authority.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor is the Speaker of the Senate and ensures that the rules of the Senate are respected by its electors.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor only votes if necessary to break ties.

name: indiana
sentence: If the Governor dies in office, becomes permanently unfit, resigns or is indicted, the Lieutenant Governor becomes Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: If the positions of governor and lieutenant governor are unoccupied, the interim president of the senator becomes governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana General Assembly consists of a 50-member Senator and a 100-member House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: The Senate is the upper house of the General Assembly and the House of Representatives is the lower house.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly has exclusive legislative authority within the Government of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Both the senator and the House can introduce a bill, except for the fact that the senator is not authorized to pass a bill that will have an impact on revenues.

name: indiana
sentence: Bills are debated and passed separately in each House, but both Houses must pass them before they are submitted to the Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The legislator may cancel the Governor's veto by voting by a majority of the full members of the Senate and the House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: Each law adopted by the General Assembly must be used without exception by the whole State.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly does not have the power to create legislation aimed at a particular community.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly can manage the State's judicial system by adjusting the size of the courts and the boundaries of their constituencies.

name: indiana
sentence: It can also oversee the activities of the executive of the state government, has limited the power to regulate county governments within the state, and has the exclusive power to initiate the method of amending the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana Supreme Court is composed of five judges with an appeal court composed of 15 judges.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor selects judges from the Supreme Courts and Appeals Courts from a group of candidates selected by a special commission.

name: indiana
sentence: After serving for two years, judges must obtain the support of the electorate to serve for a 10-year term.

name: indiana
sentence: In almost all cases, the Supreme Court does not have original jurisdiction and can only deal with cases that have been referred to it after having been heard by lower courts.

name: indiana
sentence: Local district courts are the place where most cases start with a trial and the consequences are decided by the jury.

name: indiana
sentence: The Supreme Court has initial and exclusive jurisdiction in certain areas, including the practice of law, discipline or exclusion of judges appointed to the lower courts of the State, and the control of the exercise of jurisdiction by other lower courts of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Despite its dependence on manufacturing, Indiana has been less affected by the decline in traditional Rust Belt manufacturing than many of its neighbours.

name: indiana
sentence: The explanation seems to be a number of factors in the labour market.

name: indiana
sentence: First of all, a large part of heavy manufacturing, such as industrial machinery and steel, requires a highly skilled workforce, and companies are often willing to find where there are already skills that are difficult to train.

name: indiana
sentence: Second, Indiana's labour force is found primarily in medium-sized and smaller cities rather than in very large and expensive metropolises.

name: indiana
sentence: This allows companies to offer somewhat lower wages for these skills than would normally be the case.

sentence: Iowa is a state in the Midwestern United States bordered by Mississippi to the east and Missouri and Big Sioux to the west.

sentence: Iowa, like other Midwestern states (especially Kansas, Nebraska, North Dakota and South Dakota), feels the strongest of rural flights, although Iowa has been gaining population since about 1990.

name: iowa
sentence: Some smaller communities, such as Denison and Storm Lake, have mitigated this population loss through earnings among immigrant workers.

name: iowa
sentence: Another demographic problem for Iowa is the brain drain, in which educated young adults leave the state looking for better prospects in higher education or employment.

name: iowa
sentence: During the 1990s, Iowa experienced the second highest rate of exodus for young single and educated adults, the second only for North Dakota.

sentence: English is the most common language in Iowa, used by 94% of the population.

name: iowa
sentence: William Labov and his colleagues in the monumental Atlas of North American English found that English spoken in Iowa is divided into several linguistic regions.

name: iowa
sentence: The natives of Northern Iowa – including Sioux City, Fort Dodge and the Waterloo area – intend to speak the dialect linguists known as the English dialect of North America, which is also found in North and South Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin and Michigan.

name: iowa
sentence: The natives of central and southern Iowa, including cities such as Council Bluffs, Davenport, Des Moines and Iowa City, want to speak of the Midland North dialect that is also found in eastern Nebraska, central Illinois, and central Indiana.

name: iowa
sentence: Indigenous people in Central Eastern Iowa, including cities such as Cedar Rapids, Dubuque and Clinton, tend to speak with northern cities Vowel Shift, a dialect that extends from this region and east into the Great Lakes region.

name: iowa
sentence: After English, Spanish is the second most common language spoken in Iowa, with 120,000 people in Iowa of Hispanic or Latin origin and 47,000 people born in Latin America.

name: iowa
sentence: The third most common language is German, spoken by 17,000 people in Iowa; two notable German dialects used in Iowa include German Amana spoken around the Amana colonies, and German Pennsylvania, spoken among the Amish in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The proclamation of Babel in 1918 prohibited the expression of German in public.

name: iowa
sentence: Around Pella, people of Dutch origin once spoke of the Dutch dialect of Pella.

name: iowa
sentence: The only native language regularly used in Iowa is Meskwaki, used around the Meskwaki settlement.

name: iowa
sentence: Although Iowa is often considered an agricultural state, agriculture is a relatively small part of the state's diversified economy, with manufacturing, biotechnology, financial and insurance services and government services contributing substantially to the Iowa economy.

name: iowa
sentence: This economic diversity helped Iowa to better overcome the recession of the late 2000s than most states, with unemployment well below that of the rest of the country.

name: iowa
sentence: While the economy is measured by gross domestic product, in 2005 Iowa's GDP was about $124 billion.

name: iowa
sentence: While measured by gross national product, it amounted to $113.5 billion in 2005.

sentence: In 2006, its per capita income was $23,340.

sentence: On July 2, 2009, Standard & Poor's classified Iowa's credit status as AAA (the highest of its credit ratings, held by only 11 US state governments).

name: iowa
sentence: In December 2015, the state unemployment rate was 3.4%.

name: iowa
sentence: Manufacturing is the largest sector in the Iowa economy, accounting for $20.8 billion (21%) of Iowa's gross domestic product for 2003.

name: iowa
sentence: The main manufacturing sectors are food processing, heavy machinery and agricultural chemicals.

name: iowa
sentence: Sixteen per cent of Iowa's workforce is devoted to manufacturing.

name: iowa
sentence: Food processing is the main component of manufacturing.

sentence: In addition to processed foods, industrial products include machinery, electrical equipment, chemicals, publishing and primary metals.

name: iowa

sentence: Meatpacker Tyson Foods has 11 locations, after only its headquarters Arkansas.

name: iowa
sentence: The main non-food manufacturing companies with production facilities in Iowa are: 3M, Arconic, Amana Corporation, Emerson Electric, The HON Company, SSAB, John Deere, Lennox Manufacturing, Pella Corporation, Procter & Gamble, Vermeer Company and Winnebago Industries.

name: iowa
sentence: Although on an industrial scale, basic agriculture predominates in much of the state, Iowa has grown in the organic sector.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa ranks fifth in the total number of biological holdings.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2016, there were approximately 732 organic farms in the state, an increase of about 5% over the previous year, and 103,136 organic acres, an increase of 9,429 over the previous year.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has also seen an increase in the demand for local food grown on a sustainable basis.

sentence: In 2007, direct production and sale of conventional agricultural products accounted for only about 3.5 per cent of Iowa's gross domestic product.

name: iowa

sentence: Renewable energy has become a major economic force in northern and western Iowa, and wind power generation has increased exponentially since 1990.

sentence: Iowa allows its residents to deduct their federal income tax from government income tax.

name: iowa
sentence: In Iowa, the term "political party" refers to political organizations that obtained two per cent or more of the votes cast for the President or Governor in the "last general election".

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa recognizes three political parties - the Republican Party, the Democratic Party and the Libertarian Party.

name: iowa
sentence: The Libertarian Party obtained official political party status in 2017 because presidential candidate Gary Johnson obtained 3.8% of Iowa's votes in the 2016 general election.

name: iowa
sentence: Third parties, officially referred to as "non-partite political organizations", may also appear on the ballot paper.

name: iowa
sentence: Four of them have had candidates for the Iowa elections since 2004 for various positions: the Constitutional Party, the Green Party, the Pirate Party, and the Socialist Workers' Party.

name: iowa
sentence: Following the 2010 elections, each party controlled a chamber of the Iowa General Assembly: the House had a republican majority, while the senator had a democratic majority.

name: iowa
sentence: Following the 2016 elections, the Republicans took control of the Senator.

name: iowa
sentence: Outgoing Democratic Governor Chet Culver was defeated in 2010 by Republican Terry Branstad, who had served as governor from 1983 to 1999.

name: iowa
sentence: On December 14, 2015, Branstad became the oldest governor in the history of the United States and served (at that time) 20 years, 11 months and 3 days; eclipse George Clinton, who served 21 years until 1804.

name: iowa
sentence: Lieutenant Governor Kim Reynolds succeeded him on May 24, 2017, after Branstad was appointed to the United States

name: iowa
sentence: Ambassador to China.

sentence: As of February 1, 2016, there were 2,095,639 registered electors.

name: iowa
sentence: The State receives considerable attention every four years because the Iowa caucus, a gathering of voters to select delegates to state conventions, is the first presidential caucus in the country.

name: iowa
sentence: Caucuses, held in January or February of the election year, involve people who meet in public homes or places and choose their candidates, rather than voting by secret ballot as is the case in a primary presidential election.The following week, the Iowa caucuses became the starting point for choosing the two main presidential candidates.

name: iowa
sentence: National and international media pay great attention to Iowa and New Hampshire, allowing voters in Iowa to exert a leverage effect.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2007, presidential campaign spending was the seventh highest in the country.

name: iowa
sentence: In the 19th century, Iowa was one of the first states to promulgate prohibitions against racial discrimination, especially in education, but was slow to achieve full integration in the 20th century.

name: iowa
sentence: In the first decision of the Supreme Court of Iowa — In Re the Matter of Ralph, rendered in July 1839 — the Court rejected slavery in a decision that found a slave named free Ralph when he walked on the ground of Iowa, 26 years before the end of the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: The state removed racial barriers to marriage in 1851, more than 100 years before the U.S. Supreme Court prohibited deceit laws at the national level.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Supreme Court ruled on Clark v. The Board of Directors in 1868, ruling that "separate but equal" schools of a racial nature had no place in Iowa, 85 years before Brown v. Education Board.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1875, a number of additional court decisions effectively ended segregation in Iowa schools.

name: iowa
sentence: Social and housing discrimination continued against Blacks in state universities until the 1950s.

name: iowa
sentence: The Court heard Coger v. The North Western Union Packet Co. in 1873, ruling against racial discrimination in public housing 91 years before the United States Supreme Court reached the same decision.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1884, the Iowa Civil Rights Act apparently prohibited business discrimination: "Everyone in that State has the right to the full and equal enjoyment of accommodation, benefits, facilities and privileges of inns, restaurants, cellars, dining houses, food counters and all other places where refreshments are served, public transportation, hairdressing salons, baths, theatres and all other places of fun".

name: iowa
sentence: However, the courts have chosen to apply this law strictly, allowing for the continuation of de facto discrimination.

name: iowa
sentence: Racial discrimination in public enterprises was found illegal only in 1949, when the court ruled in the State of Iowa v. Katz that companies should serve their customers regardless of their race; the case began when Edna Griffin was denied service in a Moines pharmacy.

name: iowa
sentence: Full racial civil rights have been codified under the Iowa Civil Rights Act 1965.

name: iowa
sentence: As in the case of racial equality, Iowa was the vanguard of women's rights in the mid-19th century, but did not allow women to vote before the ratification of the nineteenth amendment to the United States Constitution in 1920, with Iowa being one of the ratification votes.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1847, the University of Iowa became the first public university in the United States to admit men and women on an equal footing.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1869, Iowa became the first state in the Union to admit women to the practice of law, the Court ruling that women cannot be denied the right to practice law in Iowa and to admit Arabella A. Mansfield into the practice of law.

name: iowa
sentence: Several attempts to grant full voting rights to women in Iowa were defeated between 1870 and 1919.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1894, women obtained "partial suffrage", which allowed them to vote on the questions, but not for the candidates.

name: iowa
sentence: It is only upon ratification of the nineteenth amendment that women have full suffrage in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Although Iowa supported the federal amendment on equal rights, in 1980 and 1992, Iowa voters rejected an amendment to the State Constitution on equal rights.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1998, Iowa added the word "women" to the Iowa Constitution.

name: iowa
sentence: After the amendment, it reads as follows: "All men and women are, by nature, free and equal, and have certain inalienable rights, including those to enjoy and defend life and freedom, to acquire, possess and protect property, and to seek and obtain security and happiness."

name: iowa
sentence: In May 2018, Iowa signed one of the country's most restrictive abortion bans: the requirement that a doctor cannot perform an abortion if he detects a heartbeat, which in many cases would limit pregnancies of less than six weeks.

name: iowa
sentence: It was annulled in January 2019, when a state judge in Iowa ruled that the "fetal heartbeat" law was unconstitutional.

name: iowa
sentence: The State Act criminalizing same-sex sexual activities was repealed in June 1976, 27 years before Lawrence v. Texas.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2007, the Iowa Legislature added "sexual orientation" and "sexual identity" to the protected classes listed in the Iowa Civil Rights Act.

name: iowa
sentence: On 3 April 2009, the Supreme Court of Iowa ruled unanimously in Varnum v. Brien that the State law prohibiting homosexual marriage was unconstitutional.

sentence: Kansas is an American state located in the Midwest of the United States.

name: kansas
sentence: It is often said that the name of the tribe (naturally kko:ze) means "the people of the wind (south)" although this is probably not the original meaning of the term.

name: kansas
sentence: For thousands of years, what is now Kansas was home to many diverse Amerindian tribes.

name: kansas
sentence: The tribes of the eastern part of the State generally lived in villages along river valleys.

name: kansas

sentence: The pace of colonization accelerated in the 1850s, in the midst of political wars over the debate on slavery.

name: kansas
sentence: When it was officially opened to colonization by the American government in 1854 with the Kansas-Nebraska Act, free-state abolitionists from New England and pro-slave settlers from neighbouring Missouri rushed to the territory to determine whether the Kansas would become a free state or a slave state.

name: kansas
sentence: Thus, the region was a home of violence and chaos in its early days when these forces clashed, and was known as Bleeding Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: The abolitionists prevailed, and on 29 January 1861 Kansas entered the Union as a free state, hence the unofficial nickname "The Free State".

name: kansas
sentence: In 2015, Kansas was one of the most productive agricultural states, producing high yields of wheat, maize, sorghum and soybeans.

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas, which has an area of 82,278 square miles (213,100 square kilometers) is the 15th largest state per zone and is the 34th most populated of the 50 states with a population of 2,913,314 inhabitants.

name: kansas
sentence: The people of Kansas are called Kansans.

name: kansas
sentence: Mount Sunflower is the highest point in Kansas at 4,039 feet (1,231 metres).

sentence: Before European colonization, Kansas was occupied by the Caddoan Wichita and later by the Siuan Kaw people.

sentence: The first European to set foot in the current Kansas was the Spanish conquistador Francisco Vázquez de Coronado, who explored the region in 1541.

sentence: The Santa Fe Trail crossed Kansas from 1821 to 1880, carrying manufactured items from Missouri and silver and furs from Santa Fe, New Mexico.

sentence: In 1827 Fort Levenworth became the first permanent colony of white Americans in the future state.

sentence: The Kansas–Nebraska Act entered into force on May 30, 1854, creating the territory of Nebraska and Kansas, and opening the area to a wider settlement by whites.

sentence: The western two-thirds of the state, located in the great central plain of the United States, have a generally flat or wavy surface, while the eastern third has many hills and forests.

name: kansas
sentence: The land rises gradually from east to west, with elevations ranging from 684 ft (208 m) along the Verdigris River at Coffeyville, Montgomery County, to 4,039 ft (1,231 m) at Sunflower Mountain, 0.5 miles (0.80 km) from Colorado Border, Wallace County.

name: kansas
sentence: It is a common misconception that Kansas is the flattest state of the nation - in 2003, a language study in Cheek famously declared the state "flatter than a crepe".

name: kansas
sentence: In fact, the Kansas has a maximum topographical relief of 3,360 ft (1,020 m), making it the 23rd flattest American state measured by the maximum relief.

name: kansas
sentence: The Kansas River (known locally as Kaw), formed by the junction of the Smoky Hill and Republican rivers in Junction City, joins the Missouri River in Kansas City, after a 170-mi (270 km) course across the northeastern part of the state.

name: kansas
sentence: The Arkansas River (variable pronunciation), rising to Colorado, flows with a bending course of nearly 500 mi (800 km) across the western and southern parts of the state.

sentence: With its tributaries (La Petite Arkansas, Ninnescah, Walnut, Cow Creek, Cimarron, Verdigris and Neosho), it forms the southern drainage system of the state.

sentence: According to the climate classification of Köppen, the climate of Kansas can be characterized in three types: it has a continental, semi-arid and wet subtropical steppe.

name: kansas
sentence: Two thirds of the state (especially the northeastern part) has a humid continental climate, with cold cold winters and warm, often humid summers.

name: kansas
sentence: Most precipitation falls during summer and spring.

name: kansas
sentence: The western third of the state, from the U.S. Highway 83 corridor to the west, has a semi-arid steppe climate.

name: kansas
sentence: Summers are warm, often very hot and generally less humid.

name: kansas
sentence: Winters are very variable between warm and very cold.

name: kansas
sentence: The western region receives an average of about 16 inches (410 millimetres) of precipitation per year.

name: kansas
sentence: Winter chinook winds can warm west of Kansas to 80 degrees Fahrenheit (27 degrees Celsius).

name: kansas
sentence: The south-central and southeastern portions of the state, including the Wichita region, have a humid subtropical climate with warm and humid summers, milder winters and more precipitation than elsewhere in Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: Some of the characteristics of the three climates are found in most of the state, with droughts and changing times between dry and wet not uncommon, and both hot and cold spells in winter.

sentence: Kentucky is one of the four American states to officially use the term commonwealth.

sentence: Some early spellings are: MAINE 1086, MEINE 1200, MEINE 1204, MAYNE 1236.

sentence: Today, the village is known as Broadmayne, which is primitive Welsh or brythonic, "main" meaning rock or stone, considered as a reference to the many large sarsen stones still present around the Little Mayne farm, half a mile northeast of the village of Broadmayne.

name: maine
sentence: The first known registration of the name appears in a land charter of 10 August 1622 to Sir Ferdinando Gorges and to Captain John Mason, veterans of the British Royal Navy, who were granted a vast territory in the present Maine that Mason and Gorges "intend to appoint the Province of Maine".

name: maine
sentence: Mason had served with the Royal Navy in the Orkney Islands, where the main island is called Mainland, a possible diversion for these English sailors.

name: maine
sentence: In 1623 English naval captain Christopher Levett, exploring the coast of New England, wrote: "The first place on which I laid my foot in New England was the island of Shoals, being islands [sic] in the sea, over two leagues of the Mayne."

name: maine
sentence: Initially, several sections along the coast of New England were called Maine (cf.

name: maine
sentence: Main Spain).

name: maine
sentence: A charter reconfirmed and strengthened on April 3, 1639, by King Charles I of England, entrusted Sir Ferdinando Gorges with increased powers over his new province and declared that it "will be forever called and named the PROVINCE OR COUNTY OF MAINE, and not by any other name or name whatsoever..." Maine is the only American state whose name has only one syllable.

name: maine
sentence: The first inhabitants of the territory that is now Maine were the Algonquian Wabanaki peoples, including Passamaquoddy, Maliseet, Penobscot, Androscoggin and Kennebec.

name: maine
sentence: During the War of King Philip, many of these peoples would merge in one form or another to become the Wabanaki Confederation, helping the Wampanoag of Massachusetts and the Mahican of New York.

name: maine
sentence: Subsequently, many of these people were driven out of their natural territories, but most of the tribes of Maine continued, unchanged, until the American revolution.

name: maine
sentence: Before that, however, most of these people were considered separate nations.

name: maine
sentence: Many had adapted to life in permanent Iroquois-inspired institutions, while those along the coast tended to be semi-nomadic, moving from establishment to establishment on an annual cycle.

name: maine
sentence: They usually winter inland and head for the coasts in summer.

name: maine
sentence: European contact with what is now known as Maine may have started around 1200 CE when Norwegians interacted with the native Penobscot in today's Hancock County, probably through trade.

name: maine
sentence: If confirmed, this would make Maine the site of the first European landings in the United States.

name: maine
sentence: About 200 years earlier, from colonies in Iceland and Greenland, Norwegians first identified America and attempted to settle in areas such as Newfoundland, but failed to establish a permanent settlement.

name: maine
sentence: Archaeological evidence indicates that Greenlanders returned to North America for centuries after the initial discovery to trade and gather wood, with the most relevant evidence being Maine Penny, an 11th-century Norwegian piece found at an Amerindian excavation site in 1954.

name: maine
sentence: The first European settlement confirmed in modern Maine was in 1604 on Sainte-Croix Island, led by French explorer Pierre Dugua, Sieur de Mons.

name: maine
sentence: His party included Samuel de Champlain, a renowned explorer.

name: maine
sentence: The French name the entire region of Acadia, including the part that later became the state of Maine.

name: maine
sentence: The Plymouth Company established the first English colony in Maine at the Popham colony in 1607, the same year as the Jamestown colony in Virginia.

name: maine
sentence: Popham settlers returned to Britain after 14 months.

name: maine
sentence: The French established two Jesuit missions: one on Penobscot Bay in 1609 and the other on Desert Mountain Island in 1613.

name: maine
sentence: In the same year, Claude de La Tour created Castine.

name: maine
sentence: In 1625 Charles de Saint-Étienne de la Tour erected Fort Pentagouet to protect Castine.

name: maine
sentence: The coastal areas of Eastern Maine first became the province of Maine in a land patent of 1622.

name: maine
sentence: The western part of Maine north of the Kennebec River was more sparsely populated and was known in the 17th century as the territory of Sagadahock.

name: maine
sentence: A second colony was attempted in 1623 by English explorer and naval captain Christopher Levett in a place called York, where he had received 6,000 acres (24 km2) by King Charles I of England.

name: maine
sentence: He failed, too.

name: maine
sentence: The Central Maine was once inhabited by the Androscoggins tribe of the Abenaki Nation, also known as Arosaguntacook.

name: maine
sentence: They were driven out of the area in 1690 during the War of King William.

name: maine
sentence: They were resettled in St. Francis, Canada, which was destroyed by Rogers' Rangers in 1759, and is now Odanak.

name: maine
sentence: The other Abenaki tribes suffered several serious defeats, particularly during the Dummer War, with the capture of Norridgewock in 1724 and the defeat of the Pequawket in 1725, which greatly reduced their numbers.

name: maine
sentence: They eventually retired to Canada, where they settled in Bécancour and Sillery, and later in Saint-François, along with other southern refugee tribes.

name: maine
sentence: The province within its present borders was part of the Massachusetts Bay colony in 1652.

name: maine
sentence: Maine was much fought by the French, the English and the Allies during the 17th and 18th centuries, who carried out raids against each other, taking captives for ransom or, in some cases, adoption by the Amerindian tribes.

name: maine
sentence: One notable example is Abenaki's raid on York in early 1692, where about 100 English settlers were killed and another about 80 taken hostage.

name: maine
sentence: The Abenakis took captives during the Massachusetts raids in the Queen Anne's War of the early 1700s at Kahnewake, a Catholic Mohawk village near Montreal, where some were adopted and others bought.

name: maine
sentence: After the British defeated the French in Acadia in the 1740s, the territory of the Penobscot River fell under the nominal authority of the province of Nova Scotia and, with the present-day New Brunswick, formed Sunbury County, Nova Scotia, with its general session court in Campobello.

name: maine
sentence: American and British forces opposed the territory of Maine during the American Revolution and the War of 1812, with the British occupying eastern Maine in both conflicts via the colony of New Ireland.

name: maine
sentence: The territory of Maine was confirmed as part of Massachusetts when the United States was formed as a result of the Paris Treaty ending the revolution, although the final border with British North America was established only with the Webster-Ashburton Treaty of 1842.

name: maine
sentence: Maine was physically separated from the rest of Massachusetts.

name: maine
sentence: Long-standing disagreements over land speculation and settlements led the residents of Maine and their allies in Massachusetts to impose a vote of 1807 in the Massachusetts Assembly to allow Maine to separate.

name: maine
sentence: During the War of 1812, the pro-British merchants of Massachusetts opposed the war and refused to defend Maine against the British invaders.

name: maine
sentence: In 1819, Massachusetts agreed to allow secession, sanctioned by the rapidly growing voters of the region the following year.

name: maine
sentence: The formal secession and formation of the State of Maine as the 23rd State took place on 15 March 1820, within the framework of the Missouri compromise, which geographically limited the spread of slavery and allowed admission to the state of Missouri the following year, keeping a balance between the slave and the free states.

name: maine
sentence: The original capital of Maine is Portland, the largest city in Maine, until it was moved to the centre of Augusta in 1832.

name: maine
sentence: The main office of the Maine Supreme Court of Justice remains in Portland.

name: maine
sentence: The 20th Maine Volunteer Infantry Regiment, under the command of Colonel Joshua Lawrence Chamberlain, prevented the Union Army from being flanked at Little Round Top by the Confederate Army during the Battle of Gettysburg.

name: maine
sentence: Four ships of the U.S. Navy were named USMaine, the most famous of the armoured cruisers USMaine (ACR-1), whose shipwreck by an explosion on 15 Feb. 1898 precipitated the war of Spain and America.

name: maine
sentence: To the south and east is the Atlantic Ocean and to the northeast is New Brunswick, a province of Canada.

name: maine
sentence: The province of Quebec is to the northwest.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the northernmost state of New England and the largest, accounting for almost half of the total area of the region.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the only state that borders exactly another American state (New Hampshire).

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the easternmost state of the United States at both its extreme points and its geographical centre.

name: maine
sentence: The city of Lubec is the most organized settlement in the eastern United States.

name: maine
sentence: Its Quoddy Head Lighthouse is also the nearest location in the United States of Africa and Europe.

sentence: Moosehead Lake is the largest lake in New England, as Lake Champlain is located between Vermont, New York and Quebec.

sentence: A number of other lakes in Maine, such as South Twin Lake, are described by Thoreau in the Woods du Maine (1864).

name: maine
sentence: Mt. Katahdin is the northern terminus of the Appalachian Trail, which extends south to Springer Mountain, Georgia, and the southern terminus of the new Appalachian International Trail, which, upon completion, will travel to Belle Isle, Newfoundland and Labrador.

name: maine
sentence: Machias Seal Island and North Rock, off the east coast of the state, are claimed by Canada and the U.S. City of Cutler, and are located in one of the four areas between the two countries whose sovereignty is still in dispute, but it is the only disputed area containing land.

name: maine
sentence: In this easternmost region of the Bay of Fundy is also the old sow, the largest tidal whirlwind in the western hemisphere.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the least populated state of the United States east of Mississippi.

name: maine
sentence: It is called the state of pines; more than 80% of its land is forested or unclaimed, the most forested of an American state.

name: maine
sentence: In the forested areas of the interior there are many uninhabited lands, some of which have no official political organization in local units (a rarity in New England).

name: maine
sentence: The Northwest Aroostook, in Maine, an unorganized territory in the northern part of the state, for example, has an area of 668 square miles (6,910 km2) and a population of 10, or one person for every 267 square miles (690 km2).

name: maine
sentence: Maine is found in the biome of temperate, broad-leaved, mixed forests.

name: maine
sentence: Land near the south and central coast of the Atlantic is covered by mixed oaks from coastal forests in the northeast.

name: maine
sentence: The rest of the state, including the northern woods, is covered by the forests of New England and Acadia.

name: maine
sentence: Le Maine has nearly 400 kilometres of coastline (and 5,600 kilometres) of tidal coastline.

name: maine
sentence: West Quoddy Head, Lubec, Maine, is the most easterly point of land in the 48 contiguous states.

name: maine
sentence: Along the famous rocky coast of Maine are lighthouses, beaches, fishing villages and thousands of offshore islands, including the Shoals islands that cross the New Hampshire border.

name: maine
sentence: There are shredded rocks and cliffs and many bays and orifices.

name: maine
sentence: The interior is lakes, rivers, forests and mountains.

name: maine
sentence: This visual contrast of the wooded slopes sweeping to the sea was summarized by American poet Edna St. Vincent Millay of Rockland and Camden, Maine, in "Renascence":

name: maine
sentence: Geologists describe this type of landscape as an "unknown coast", where sea-level rise has invaded ancient terrestrial features, creating bays of valleys and islands from mountainous peaks.

name: maine
sentence: A rise in land due to the melting of strong glacial ice caused a slight rebound in the underlying rock; however, this rise in land was not sufficient to eliminate all the effects of sea-level rise and its invasion of old land features.

name: maine
sentence: Much of Maine's geomorphology was created by prolonged glacial activity at the end of the last glacial period.

name: maine
sentence: Key glacial features include Somes Strait and Bubble Rock, both of which are part of Acadia National Park on Mount Desert Island.

name: maine
sentence: Cut by glaciers, the Strait of Somes is considered the only fjord on the east coast and reaches a depth of 175 feet (50 m).

name: maine
sentence: Extreme depth and steep fall allow large boats to navigate almost the entire length of the sound.

name: maine
sentence: These features have also made it attractive for boat builders, such as the prestigious Hinckley Yachts.

name: maine
sentence: Bubble Rock, a glacial erratic, is a large rock perched on the edge of Mount Bubble in Acadia National Park.

name: maine
sentence: By analyzing the type of granite, geologists discovered that the glaciers transported Bubble Rock to its current location from near Lucerne, 48 km away.

name: maine
sentence: The Iapetus Suture crosses the north and west of the state, being submarine by the former Laurentian terrane, and the south and is submarine by the Avalonian terrane.

name: maine
sentence: Acadia National Park is the only national park in New England.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfb), with warm and sometimes humid summers, and long, cold and very snowy winters.

name: maine
sentence: Winters are particularly severe in the north and west of Maine, while coastal areas are slightly moderated by the Atlantic Ocean, resulting in milder winters and cooler summers than inland areas.

name: maine
sentence: Daytime peaks are generally between 75 and 80°F (24 and 27°C) in the state as a whole in July, with nightfalls in the high 50°F (approximately 15°C).

name: maine
sentence: January temperatures range from 30°F (−1°C) on the south coast to an average of 0°F (−18°C) at night in the extreme north.

name: maine
sentence: The record state temperature is 105°F (41°C), set in July 1911, at North Bridgton.Precipitation in Maine is evenly distributed throughout the year, but with a slight summer maximum in north/northwest Maine and a slight end of fall or beginning of winter along the coast due to "no'east" or intense cold season rains and snow storms.

name: maine
sentence: In coastal Maine, the late spring and summer months are generally the driest, a rarity in the eastern United States.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has fewer storm days than any other state east of the Rocky Mountains, most of which are on average less than 20 storm days per year.

name: maine
sentence: Tornadoes are rare in Maine, with the state having an average of less than four per year, although this number is increasing.

name: maine
sentence: The most severe storms and tornadoes occur in the state's Sebago lakes and foothills.

name: maine
sentence: Maine rarely sees the effect of tropical cyclones, as they tend to pass well to the east and south or are strongly weakened when they reach Maine.

name: maine
sentence: In January 2009, a new low-temperature record for the state was set at Big Black River at -50°F (−46°C), linking the New England record.

name: maine
sentence: Annual precipitation ranges from 909 mm (35.8") in Presque Island to 1,441 mm (56.7") in Acadia National Park.

name: maine
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Maine's population was 1,344,212 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 1.19% compared to the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: maine
sentence: The population density of the state is 41.3 people per square mile, making it the least densely populated state east of the Mississippi River.

name: maine
sentence: In 2010, Maine was also the most rural state in the Union, with only 38.7% of the population of the state living in urban areas.

name: maine
sentence: As explained in detail under "Geography", there are large expanses of uninhabited land in some remote parts of the interior of the state, particularly in the woods of the North Maine.

name: maine
sentence: Maine's middle population centre is located in Kennebec County, east of Augusta.

name: maine
sentence: The Greater Portland metropolitan area is the most populated, with nearly 40% of Maine's population.

name: maine
sentence: This area covers three counties and includes many farms and forested areas; the population of Portland proper in 2016 was 66,937 inhabitants.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has experienced a very slow rate of population growth since the 1990 census.

name: maine
sentence: The modest population growth of the state has been concentrated in the southern coastal counties.

name: maine
sentence: However, the northern and more rural regions of the state have experienced a slight decline in population in recent years.

name: maine
sentence: According to the 2010 census, Maine represents the highest percentage of non-Hispanic whites in all states, representing 94.4 per cent of the total population.

name: maine
sentence: In 2011, 89.0% of all births in the state were due to non-Hispanic white parents.

name: maine
sentence: Maine also has the second highest population of seniors.

sentence: According to the 2016 U.S. Community Survey, 1.5% of the population of Maine were of Hispanic or Latin origin (of any race): Mexican (0.4%), Puerto Rican (0.4%), Cuban (0.1%) and other Hispanic or Latin origin (0.6%).

name: maine
sentence: The five main ancestry groups were English (20.7 per cent), Irish (17.3 per cent), French (15.7 per cent), German (8.1 per cent) and American (7.8 per cent).

name: maine
sentence: The people quoting they are Americans are of predominantly English origin, but have an ancestry that has been in the area for so long (often since the 1600s) that they simply choose to identify as Americans.

sentence: Maine has the highest percentage of French Americans in any state.

name: maine
sentence: Most of them are of Canadian origin, but in some cases they have lived there since before the American Revolutionary War.

sentence: There are particularly high concentrations in the northern part of Maine in Aroostook County, which is part of a cultural region known as Acadia that crosses the border in New Brunswick.

name: maine
sentence: In addition to the Acadian population of the North, many French came from Quebec as immigrants between 1840 and 1930.

sentence: The upper part of the St. John River valley was once part of the so-called Madawaska Republic, before the boundary was decided in the Webster-Ashburton Treaty of 1842.

name: maine
sentence: More than a quarter of the population of Lewiston, Waterville and Biddeford are Franco-American.

name: maine
sentence: Most of the inhabitants of the Mid Coast and Down East sections are mainly of British origin.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has no official language, but the most widely spoken language in the state is English.

name: maine
sentence: According to the 2000 census, 92.25 per cent of residents of Maine aged five and over spoke only English at home.

name: maine
sentence: Francophones are the largest linguistic minority in the state; census figures show that Maine has the highest percentage of people speaking French at home in any state: 5.28% of households in Maine are Francophones, compared to 4.68% in Louisiana, which is the second highest state.

name: maine
sentence: Although rarely spoken, Spanish is the third most common language in Maine, after English and French.

name: maine
sentence: Maine's agricultural production includes poultry, eggs, dairy products, cattle, wild blueberries, apples, maple syrup and maple sugar.

name: maine
sentence: Aroostook County is known for its potato crops.

name: maine
sentence: Commercial fishing, which was once a pillar of the state economy, maintains a presence, particularly lobster and bottom fishing.

name: maine
sentence: Although lobster is Maine's main sea fish, oyster and seaweed catches are increasing.

name: maine
sentence: In 2015, 14% of the total supply of Northeast oysters came from Maine.

name: maine
sentence: In 2017, the production of the Maine alga industry was estimated at $20 million per year.

name: maine
sentence: The Maine shrimp industry is located in a hold under government mandate.

name: maine
sentence: Given the continuing decline in the northern shrimp population, Maine fishers are no longer allowed to fish and sell shrimp.

name: maine
sentence: The suspension started in 2014 and is expected to continue until 2021.

name: maine
sentence: Aquifers and sources in the western Maine are a major source of bottled water.

name: maine
sentence: Maine's industrial products are mainly paper, lumber and wood products, electronic equipment, leather products, food products, textiles and biotechnology.

name: maine
sentence: Shipbuilding and construction are also essential, with Bath Iron Works in Bath and Portsmouth Naval Shipyard in Kittery.

name: maine
sentence: Brunswick Landing, formerly the Brunswick Naval Air Station, is also in Maine.

name: maine
sentence: Formerly a major base of support for the U.S. Navy, the BRAC campaign began the closure of the Naval Air Station, despite a government-funded effort to modernize its facilities.

name: maine
sentence: The former base has since been transformed into a civilian business park, as well as a new satellite campus for Southern Maine Community College.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the first American producer of low-leaf blueberries (Vaccinium angustifolium).

name: maine
sentence: Preliminary USDA data for 2012 also indicate that Maine was the largest blueberry producer in the major blueberry-producing states, with 91,100,000 lbs.

name: maine
sentence: These data include both low (wild) blueberries and high (cultivated) blueberries: Vaccinium corymbosum.

name: maine
sentence: The largest toothpick plant in the United States was located in Strong, Maine.

name: maine
sentence: The Strong Wood Products plant produced 20 million toothpicks a day.

name: maine
sentence: It was closed in May 2003.

name: maine
sentence: Tourism and outdoor recreation play a major and increasingly important role in Maine's economy.

name: maine
sentence: The state is a popular destination for sport hunting (especially deer, moose and bears), sport fishing, snowmobile, skiing, navigation, camping and hiking, among other activities.

name: maine
sentence: Historically, the ports of Maine played a key role in national transport.

name: maine
sentence: From 1880, the Portland rail link and ice-free harbour became Canada's main winter port, until the dynamic development of Halifax, Nova Scotia, in the mid 1900s.

name: maine
sentence: In 2013, 12,039,600 short tons entered and exited Portland by sea, placing it at 45th place in U.S. water ports.

name: maine
sentence: Portland Maine's Portland International Jetport has recently been expanded, allowing the state to increase air traffic for carriers such as JetBlue and Southwest Airlines.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has very few large Crown-owned companies, and this number has declined as a result of consolidations and mergers, particularly in the pulp and paper industry.

name: maine
sentence: The largest companies in Maine include Fairchild Semiconductor in southern Portland, IDEXX Laboratories in Westbrook, Hannaford Bros. Co. in Scarborough, TD Bank in Portland, L.L. Bean in Freeport and Cole Haan in Yarmouth.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is also home to Jackson Laboratory, the world's largest not-for-profit mammal genetic research centre and the world's largest supplier of genetically pure mice.

name: maine
sentence: Maine's income tax structure consists of two tranches, 6.5% and 7.95 % of personal income.

name: maine
sentence: Prior to July 2013, Maine had four square brackets: 2, 4.5, 7 and 8.5%.

name: maine
sentence: The general sales tax rate in Maine is 5.5%.

name: maine
sentence: The government also charges nine per cent on accommodation and prepared food and ten per cent on short-term car rental.

name: maine
sentence: Commercial blueberry vendors, a staple food in Maine, are required to keep records of their transactions and pay for 1.5 cents per pound ($1.50 per 100 pounds) of the fruit sold each season.

name: maine
sentence: All real and tangible personal property situated in the State of Maine is taxable unless expressly exempted by law.

name: maine
sentence: Property tax administration is managed by the local assessor in incorporated cities, while property tax in non-organized territories is managed by the state tax assessor.

name: maine
sentence: Le Maine has a long tradition of welcoming many shipbuilding companies.

name: maine
sentence: In the 18th and 19th centuries, Maine housed many shipyards that made wooden sailboats.

name: maine
sentence: The main function of these ships was to transport goods or passengers abroad.

name: maine
sentence: One of these sites was located in the historic district of Pennellville in what is now Brunswick, Maine.

name: maine
sentence: This court, which belonged to the Pennell family, was typical of the many family shipbuilding companies of the time.

name: maine
sentence: Other examples of shipbuilding families were the Skolfields and the Morses.

name: maine
sentence: During the 18th and 19th centuries, wooden shipbuilding was an important part of the economy.

name: maine
sentence: Maine receives passenger jet service at its two largest airports, Portland International Jetport in Portland, and Bangor International Airport in Bangor.

name: maine
sentence: Both are served daily by many major airlines to destinations such as New York, Atlanta and Orlando.

name: maine
sentence: Essential Air Service also subsidizes service at a number of small Maine airports, bringing small turboprop aircraft to regional airports such as Augusta State Airport, Hancock-Bar Harbor County Airport, Knox County Regional Airport and Presque Isle Northern Maine Regional Airport.

name: maine
sentence: These airports are served by regional suppliers such as Cape Air with Cessna 402, PenAir with Saab 340 and CommutAir with Embraer ERJ 145.

name: maine
sentence: Many small airports are scattered throughout Maine, serving only general air traffic.

name: maine
sentence: Eastport Municipal Airport, for example, is a public airport owned by the city, where 1,200 general aviation aircraft operate annually from single-engine and ultra-light aircraft.

name: maine
sentence: Interstate 95 (I-95) crosses Maine, its East branch I-295 and its spurs I-195, I-395 and the unsigned I-495 (the Falmouth Spur).

name: maine
sentence: In addition, US Route 1 (US 1) starts in Fort Kent and travels to Florida.

name: maine
sentence: The eastern terminus of the eastern section of the U.S. 2 begins in Houlton, near the border of New Brunswick, Canada, to Rousses Point, New York, U.S. 11.

name: maine
sentence: The US 2A connects Old Town and Orono, which mainly serves the University of Maine campus.

name: maine
sentence: The United States 201 and the United States 202 cross the state.

name: maine
sentence: US 2, Maine State Route 6 (SR 6) and SR 9 are often used by truckers and other motorists from the Maritime provinces on their way to other destinations in the United States or as a short reduction to central Canada.

name: maine
sentence: The Downeaster passenger train, operated by Amtrak, provides passenger service between Brunswick and the North Station of Boston, with stops at Freeport, Portland, Old Orchard Beach, Saco and Wells.

name: maine
sentence: The Downeast makes five daily trips.

name: maine
sentence: Government-wide freight service is provided by a handful of regional and short line carriers: Pan Am Railways (formerly Guilford Rail System), which operates the former Boston & Maine and Maine Central tracks; St. Lawrence and Atlantic Railroad; Maine Eastern Railroad; Central Maine and Quebec Railway; and New Brunswick Southern Railway.

name: maine
sentence: The Constitution of Maine forms the government of the State of Maine, composed of three co-equal branches: the executive, legislative and judicial branches.

name: maine
sentence: The State of Maine also has three constitutional officials (the Secretary of State, the Treasurer of State and the Attorney-General of the State) and one statutory official (the Auditor).

name: maine
sentence: The legislature is the legislative body of Maine, a bicameral body composed of the House of Representatives of Maine, with 151 members, and the Senate of Maine, with 35 members.

name: maine
sentence: The Legislative Assembly is responsible for introducing and enacting laws.

name: maine
sentence: The executive branch is responsible for the enforcement of laws created by the Legislative Assembly and is headed by the Governor of Maine (currently Janet Mills).

name: maine
sentence: The Governor is elected every four years.

name: maine
sentence: The current Attorney General of Maine is Aaron Frey.

name: maine
sentence: As with other state legislatures, the Maine Legislative Assembly may, by a two-thirds majority vote of the House and the Senators, cancel a gibernatory veto.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is one of the seven states that do not have a lieutenant governor.

name: maine
sentence: The judiciary is responsible for interpreting the laws of States.

name: maine
sentence: The highest court in the state is the Supreme Court of Justice of Maine.

name: maine
sentence: The lower courts are the District Court, the Superior Court and the Probation Court.

name: maine
sentence: All judges, except full-time judges, are appointed by the Governor and confirmed by the Legislative Assembly for a term of seven years.

name: maine
sentence: The trial judges sit on a part-time basis and are elected by the voters of each county for a four-year term.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is divided into political districts designated as counties.

name: maryland
sentence: Sixteen of the twenty-three counties of Maryland, as well as the city of Baltimore, border the tidal waters of the Chesapeake Bay estuary and its many tributaries, which total more than 4,000 miles of shoreline.

name: maryland
sentence: Although one of the smallest states in the United States, it has a variety of climates and topographical features that have earned it the name of America in Miniature.

sentence: Before its shores were explored by Europeans in the 16th century, Maryland was inhabited by several groups of Amerindians, mainly Algonquins, and to a lesser extent by the Iroquois and Sioux.

sentence: Unlike pilgrims and Puritans, who rejected Catholicism in their colonies, Lord Baltimore envisaged a colony where people from different religious sects coexisted under the principle of tolerance.

name: maryland
sentence: Nevertheless, religious conflicts were common in the early years, and Catholics remained a minority, although in larger numbers than in any other English colony.

sentence: Maryland has a variety of topography within its borders, contributing to its American nickname in Miniature.

sentence: Massachusetts is the 7th smallest state in the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is located in the New England region of the northeastern United States and has an area of 10,555 square miles (27,340 km2), of which 25.7% is water.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Several large bays clearly shape its coast.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston is the largest city at the end of Massachusetts Bay and the mouth of the Charles River.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Despite its small size, Massachusetts has many distinct topographical regions.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The great coastal plain of the Atlantic Ocean in the eastern part of the state contains Greater Boston, as well as most of the state's population, as well as the distinctive Cape Cod Peninsula.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To the west is the hilly, rural area of central Massachusetts and beyond, the Connecticut River Valley.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Along the western border of Western Massachusetts lies the highest part of the state, the Berkshires.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The U.S. National Parks Service administers a number of natural and historical sites in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, the Department of Conservation and Recreation maintains a number of parks, trails and beaches throughout Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Although much of Massachusetts has been cleared for agriculture, leaving only traces of old forest in isolated pockets, secondary growth has regenerated in many rural areas as farms have been abandoned.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Currently, forests cover about 62% of Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The areas most affected by human development include the Greater Boston area to the east and the Springfield metropolitan area to the west, although the latter includes agricultural areas throughout the Connecticut River Valley.

name: massachusetts
sentence: There are currently 219 endangered species in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A number of species are doing well in Massachusetts, which is increasingly urbanized.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Peregrine falcons use office towers in large cities as nesting areas, and the population of coyotes, whose diet may include garbage and road slaughter, has increased in recent decades.

name: massachusetts
sentence: White-tailed deer, raccoons, wild turkeys and eastern grey squirrels are also present throughout Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the more rural areas of western Massachusetts, large mammals such as moose and black bears have returned, largely due to reforestation as a result of the regional decline in agriculture.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is located along the Atlantic Flyway, an important route for migratory waterfowl along the east coast.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The lakes in central Massachusetts provide habitat for many species of fish and waterfowl, but some species, such as common loon, become rare.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A large population of long-tailed ducks winters off Nantucket.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Small offshore islands and beaches are home to flourishing terns and are important breeding grounds for locally threatened piping plover.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Protected areas such as the Monomoy National Wildlife Sanctuary provide critical breeding habitat for shorebirds and a variety of marine wildlife, including a large grey seal population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Since 2009, the number of Great White Sharks identified and labelled in coastal waters off Cape Cod has increased significantly.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Freshwater fish species in Massachusetts include bass, carp, catfish and trout, while saltwater species such as Atlantic cod, haddock and American lobster inhabit offshore waters.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other marine species include harbour seals, endangered North Atlantic right whales, humpback whales, fin whales, communal whales and dolphins on the white side of the Atlantic.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The corn borer, a major agricultural pest, was first found in North America near Boston, Massachusetts, in 1917.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The majority of Massachusetts has a humid continental climate, with cold winters and warm summers.

sentence: The coastal areas of the extreme southeast are the vast transition zone to humid subtropical climates.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Hot to hot summers make the ocean climate rare in this transition, applying only to exposed coastal areas such as the Barnstable County Peninsula.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Boston climate is fairly representative of the commonwealth, characterized by summer heights of about 81°F (27°C) and winter heights of 35°F (2°C), and is quite humid.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Frosts are common all winter, even in coastal areas due to prevailing internal winds.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Because of its location near the Atlantic, Massachusetts is not vulnerable to human beings, hurricanes and tropical storms.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Climate change in Massachusetts will affect urban and rural environments, including forestry, fisheries, agriculture and coastal development.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The northeast is expected to warm faster than the global average; by 2035, the northeast is expected to warm by more than 3.6°F (2°C) on average than in the pre-industrial era.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In August 2016, the EPA reported that Massachusetts warmed up by more than two degrees Fahrenheit, or 1.1 degrees Celsius.

name: massachusetts
sentence: That's close to double the United States' contiguous average.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Temperature changes also result in a change in precipitation patterns and an increase in precipitation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For this purpose, average precipitation in the northeastern United States increased by 10 per cent between 1895 and 2011, and the number of heavy precipitation increased by 70 per cent during this period.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These increased precipitation trends are concentrated in winter and spring.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Increased temperatures and increased precipitation will result in earlier snowmelts and drier soils in the summer months.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Climate change in Massachusetts will bring about a significant change in the built environment and ecosystems.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Boston alone, the cost of climate change storms will result in damage of $5 to $100 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These costs are attributed to the damage that coastal homes are expected to cause, the destruction of roads, and the current exposure to public service infrastructure.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Warmer temperatures will also disrupt bird migration and plant growth.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As a result of these changes, deer populations are expected to increase, resulting in a decrease in the undergrowth used as camouflage by smaller wildlife.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, rising temperatures will increase the number of reported cases of Lyme disease in the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Ticks can transmit disease when temperatures reach 45 degrees, so shorter winters will increase the transmission window.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These warmer temperatures will also increase the prevalence of mosquitoes carrying West Nile virus.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To combat this change, the state of Massachusetts Executive Office of Energy and Environmental Affairs has defined a path towards decarbonization of the state economy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On 22 April 2020, the Massachusetts Secretary of Energy and Environmental Affairs, Kathleen A. Theoharides, published a state-wide emission limit determination for 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In its letter, Theoharides points out that as of 2020, the Commonwealth has suffered material damage due to climate change of more than $60 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To ensure that the Commonwealth does not warm up more than 1.5°C of pre-industrial levels, the state will strive to achieve zero net emissions and an overall reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 85 percent by 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State of Massachusetts has developed a plethora of incentives to encourage the implementation of renewable energy, appliances and efficient domestic facilities.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save was created in collaboration with the state by Berkshire Gas, Blackstone Gas Company, Cape Light Compact, Eversource, Liberty Utilities, National Grid and Unitil to provide homeowners and tenants with incentives to upgrade their homes with efficient HVAC equipment and other household appliances.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For example, a $100 discount can be obtained for upgrading an ENERGY STAR certified smart or programmable thermostat.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other appliances such as water heaters, air conditioners, washers, dryers and heat pumps are eligible for additional discounts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The concept of Mass Save was created in 2008 by the adoption of the Green Communities Act 2008 during the mandate of Deval Patrick.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The main objective of the Green Communities Act was to reduce fossil fuel consumption in the state and to encourage new and more efficient technologies.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Among other things, one of the results of this law was the obligation for public service program administrators to invest in energy saving, as opposed to the purchase and production of additional energy where economically feasible.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Massachusetts, eleven program administrators, including NSTAR, National Grid, Western Massachusetts Electric, Cape Light Compact, Till and Berkshire Gas, jointly hold the program rights, in collaboration with the Ministry of Energy Resources (DOER) and the Advisory Council on Energy Efficiency (CCEE).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save also conducts home energy assessments at no cost so that homeowners, tenants and small business owners can learn about energy efficiency home improvements and find opportunities to save money and energy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: During the home evaluation, Mass Save provides ENERGY STAR certified LED bulbs, power bands, low-flow shower heads, faucet aerators and effective thermostats for free.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, air leaks will be detected in the house or building and corrected, and recommendations will be made to install additional insulation to reduce the loss of heated or cooled air.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Reductions of 75 per cent or more are available on these insulation improvements.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Thanks to COVID-19, Mass Save is currently conducting remote assessments.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents can program a remote evaluation using the program's website or telephone line.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State Income Service provides incentives for the installation of solar panels.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to the federal residential renewable energy credit, residents of Massachusetts may be eligible for a tax credit of up to 15 per cent of the project.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Once installed, the tables can be used for net measurement.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some municipalities will offer up to $1.20 per power, up to 50% of the cost of the system on photovoltaic networks of 25 kW or less.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Department of Energy also provides low-interest fixed-rate financing and loan support to low-income residents.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This programme is expected to cease on 31 December 2020.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As part of the Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources' efforts to encourage the use of renewable energy, the MOR-EV or Massachusetts Offers Debates for Electric Vehicles initiative was created.

name: massachusetts
sentence: With this incentive measure, residents may be entitled to a state incentive of up to $2,500 for the purchase or rental of an electric vehicle, or $1,500 for the purchase or rental of a plug-in hybrid vehicle.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This rebate is in addition to the U.S. Department of Energy's tax credits for the purchase of electric and rechargeable hybrid vehicles.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For income-eligible residents, Mass Save has partnered with Massachusetts Community Action Program and LEAN (Low-Income Energy Affordability Network) organizations to provide housing improvement assistance to residents, which will result in more efficient use of energy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents may be entitled to a replacement of their heating system, insulation system, appliances and thermostats if they meet the income conditions set out on the Mass Save website.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For residents of more than 5 family residential buildings, there are additional limited income benefits available through LEAN.

name: massachusetts
sentence: If at least 50 per cent of the building's residents are eligible for low income, energy efficiency improvements such as those available through Mass Save are available.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residential structures managed by non-profit organizations, for gainful activities or housing organizations can benefit from these programs.

name: massachusetts
sentence: By the end of 2020, the Baker Administration has released a roadmap for decarbonization that targets net greenhouse gas emissions by zero by 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The plan foresees significant investments in offshore wind and solar energy and would require all new cars sold to zero emissions (electricity or hydrogen) by 2035.

name: massachusetts

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has avoided many forms of racial conflict seen elsewhere in the United States, but examples such as the successful electoral demonstrations of the nativist (mainly anti-Catholic) know nothing in the 1850s, the controversial executions of Sacco and Vanzetti in the 1920s, and Boston's opposition to desegregation in the 1970s show that the ethnic history of Massachusetts was not completely harmonious.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The most common varieties of American English spoken in Massachusetts, with the exception of General American, are the distinct, rhotic dialect of western Massachusetts and the merged, non-rhotic dialect of eastern Massachusetts (called "Boston accent").

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2010, 78.93% (4,823,127) of residents of Massachusetts aged 5 and over spoke English at home as their mother tongue, while 7.50% (458,256) spoke Spanish, 2.97% (181,437) Portuguese, 1.59% (96,690) Chinese (including Cantonese and Mandarin), 1.11% (67,788) French, 0.89% (54,456) French Creole, 0.72% (43,798) Italian, 0.62% (37,865) Russian and Vietnamese were spoken as their primary language of 0.58% (35,283) of the population over 5.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was founded and established by the Crownist Puritans in 1620 and shortly thereafter by other groups of separatists/dissidents, non-conformist and independent of 17th century England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Today, the majority of the population of Massachusetts remains Christian.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The descendants of Puritans belong to many different churches; in the direct line of the inheritance are the different congregational churches, the United Church of Christ and the congregations of the Unitarian Universalist Association.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The headquarters of the Unitarian Universalist Association, which has long been located on Beacon Hill, is now located in southern Boston.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many Puritan descendants have also dispersed into other Protestant denominations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some are disaffiliated with Roman Catholics and other Christian groups as a result of modern secularization.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Today, Christians make up 57 per cent of the population of the State and Protestants account for 21 per cent of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Roman Catholics account for 34% and predominate today due to massive immigration mainly from Catholic countries and regions, mainly Ireland, Italy, Poland, Portugal, Quebec and Latin America.

name: massachusetts

sentence: It is the most unreligious region in the country, with the Western United States.

sentence: Mary Baker Eddy made the Boston Mother Church of Christian Science the world headquarters of this new religious movement.

sentence: The Kripalu Centre in Stockbridge, the Shaolin Meditation Temple in Springfield and the Insight Meditation Centre in Barre are examples of non-abramic religious centres in Massachusetts.

sentence: The name Montana was added in 1863 to a bill of the United States House Committee on Territories (then chaired by James Ashley of Ohio) for the territory that would become the territory of Idaho.

sentence: The name was changed by representatives Henry Wilson (Massachusetts) and Benjamin F. Harding (Oregon), who complained Montana had "no meaning."

name: nevada
sentence: Under the Constitution of the State of Nevada, the powers of the Government of Nevada are divided into three separate departments: the Executive, composed of the Governor of Nevada and their Cabinet, as well as other elected members of the Constitution; the Legislative, composed of the Legislative Assembly of Nevada and the Senate; and the Judicial, composed of the Supreme Court of Nevada and the lower courts.

sentence: The Nevada Legislature is a bicameral body divided into an assembly and a senator.

sentence: The members of the Assembly sit for two years, and the members of the Senate for four years.

name: nevada
sentence: The two chambers of the Nevada Legislative Assembly will be affected by the time limits from 2010, since senators and deputies/women will be limited to a maximum of 12 years in each chamber (by appointment or election that is a lifetime limit) – a provision of the Constitution that was recently confirmed by the Nevada Supreme Court in a unanimous decision.

sentence: Nevada's tax laws are designed to attract new residents and businesses to the state.
