sentence: The first permanent immigration depot in New York was established in 1855 at Castle Garden, a fort converted from the era of the War of 1812 in what is now Battery Park, at the tip of Lower Manhattan.

name: new_york
sentence: When the federal government took control, it created the Immigration Bureau, which chose the three-acre Ellis Island in Upper New York Harbour for an entry depot.

sentence: Already under federal control, the island was an ammunition depot.

sentence: It was chosen because of its relative isolation with the proximity to New York City and the railway lines of Jersey City, New Jersey, by a short ferry ride.

sentence: While the island was being developed and expanded by land reclamation, the federal government operated a temporary storage facility at the Barge battery office.

name: new_york
sentence: Ellis Island opened its doors on January 1, 1892 and operated as a central immigration centre until the passage of the National Origins Act in 1924, thereby reducing immigration.

name: new_york
sentence: After that date, the only immigrants to pass were displaced persons or war refugees.

name: new_york
sentence: The largest Roman Catholic diocese is the Archdiocese of the Latin Church of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The largest Eastern Catholic diocese is the Ruthenian Catholic Eparchy of Passaic of the Ruthenian Greek Catholic Church.

name: new_york
sentence: The United Methodist Church is the largest main Protestant denomination and the second largest on the whole, followed by the Episcopal Church in the United States and other continuing Anglican organizations.

name: new_york
sentence: The Presbyterian Church (USA), the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America and the American Baptist Church were the following major denominations.

name: new_york
sentence: The main Protestants together account for 11 per cent of the state's Christians.

name: new_york
sentence: In evangelical Protestantism the Baptists, non-denominational Protestants and Pentecostals were the largest groups.

name: new_york
sentence: The National Baptist Convention (USA) and the Progressive National Baptist Convention were the largest Protestant churches in New York's black history.

name: new_york
sentence: About 10% of New York Christians are evangelical Protestants.

name: new_york
sentence: Eastern Orthodox and Eastern Orthodox made up 1% of the religious population alongside Jehovah's Witnesses and other Christians.

name: new_york
sentence: Non-Christian religions accounted for 12% of the religious population.

name: new_york
sentence: Judaism is the second most important religion as of 2014.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2010, 588,500 men practiced Orthodox Judaism.

name: new_york
sentence: Just over 392,953 professed Islam.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is home to Zoroastrian's oldest fire temple in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: Less than 1% of New York's population practise New Age and contemporary paganism.

name: new_york
sentence: Amerindian religions are also an important minority.

name: new_york
sentence: Irreligiousism is a growing community in the New York metropolitan area.

name: new_york
sentence: State-wide, 17% do nothing in particular and 5% are atheistic and agnostic.

name: new_york
sentence: Approximately 3.8 per cent of the adult population in the state is identified as lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender.

name: new_york
sentence: This represents a total population of 570,388 LGBT adults.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2010, the number of same-sex households was approximately 48,932.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is the fifth state to allow same-sex marriages after New Hampshire.

name: new_york
sentence: Michael Bloomberg, Mayor of New York City, said that "same-sex marriages in New York generated approximately $259 million in economic impact and $16 million in municipal revenue" in the first year after the passage of the Marriage Equality Act.

name: new_york
sentence: Same-sex marriages in New York were legalized on 24 June 2011 and were allowed to begin 30 days thereafter.

name: new_york
sentence: The city of New York is also home to the largest transgender population in the United States, estimated at 25,000 in 2016.

name: new_york
sentence: The annual New York Pride March (or gay pride parade) crosses 5th Avenue in Manhattan, ending at Greenwich Village, and rivals the Sao Paulo Gay Pride Parade as the largest pride parade in the world, attracting tens of thousands of participants and millions of spectators on the sidewalks each June.

name: new_york
sentence: The Stonewall riots were a series of spontaneous and violent demonstrations by members of the gay community against a police raid that took place in the early morning of June 28, 1969 at Stonewall Inn, Greenwich Village, Lower Manhattan.

name: new_york
sentence: They are generally considered to be the most important event leading to the gay liberation movement and the modern struggle for LGBT rights.

name: new_york
sentence: In June 2017, plans were announced for the first official LGBT monument commissioned by the state of New York, unlike the Stonewall National Monument, commissioned by the U.S. federal government.

name: new_york
sentence: The State Monument should be built in the Hudson River Park in Manhattan, near the Hudson River wharves, which have been important historical symbols of New York's central role as a meeting place and refuge for LGBT communities.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2017, New York also planned to host the largest international celebration of LGBT pride in 2019, known as Stonewall 50 – WorldPride NYC 2019, to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Stonewall riots.

name: new_york
sentence: In New York, the 2019 Stonewall 50–WorldPride NYC events produced by Heritage of Pride were enhanced through a partnership with the LGBT division of the I LOVE NY program and included a welcome centre during the weeks surrounding the Stonewall 50 / WorldPride events that was open to all.

name: new_york
sentence: Other commemorative, cultural and educational arts programs to mark the 50th anniversary of the rebellion at Stonewall Inn took place throughout the city and around the world; Stonewall 50 – WorldPride NYC 2019 was the largest celebration of LGBT pride in history, attracting about five million people.

name: new_york
sentence: Brooklyn Liberation March, the largest event on transgender rights in LGBTQ history, took place on June 14, 2020, from Grand Army Plaza to Fort Greene, Brooklyn, and focused on supporting the lives of black transgender people, attracting between 15,000 and 20,000 participants.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2018, New York's gross national product was $1.7 trillion.

name: new_york
sentence: If the State of New York were an independent nation, it would be the 11th largest economy in the world.

name: new_york
sentence: However, in 2013, the multi-state metropolitan statistical area, centred on the city of New York, produced a gross metropolitan product (GMP) of nearly $1.4 trillion, while in 2012, the corresponding combined statistical area produced a GMP of more than $1.7 trillion, both of which ranked first in a broad margin and behind the GDP of only nine countries.

name: new_york
sentence: Anchored by Wall Street in the Financial District of Lower Manhattan, New York City was called both the most economically powerful city and the largest financial centre in the world.

name: new_york
sentence: Lower Manhattan is the third largest business district in the United States and houses the New York Stock Exchange at Wall Street and NASDAQ at 165 Broadway, representing respectively the largest and second largest stock exchanges in the world, as measured by both the average volume of daily transactions and the total market capitalization of their listed companies in 2013.

name: new_york
sentence: The investment bank charges on Wall Street amounted to approximately $40 billion in 2012, while in 2013, the senior management of New York banks that manage the risk management and compliance functions earned up to $324,000 per year.

name: new_york
sentence: During the 2013–14 fiscal year, the Wall Street securities industry generated 19% of New York State's tax revenues.

name: new_york
sentence: The city of New York remains the world's largest trading centre in the public capital and debt markets, partly driven by the size and financial development of the U.S. economy.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is also a leader in hedge fund management

name: new_york
sentence: Several investment banks and investment managers headquartered in Manhattan are important participants in other global financial centres.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is also the largest commercial banking centre in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: Many of the world's largest media conglomerates are also based in the city.

name: new_york
sentence: Manhattan had approximately 520 million square feet (48.1 million square feet) of office space in 2013, making it the largest office market in the United States, while Midtown Manhattan is the largest business district in the country.

name: new_york
sentence: Silicon Alley, centered in New York, became a metanym of the sphere encompassing the high-tech and entrepreneurship ecosystem of the New York metropolitan area; in 2015, Silicon Alley generated more than $7.3 billion in venture capital investments.

name: new_york
sentence: High-tech industries, including digital media, biotechnology, software development, game design and other areas in the field of information technology, are growing, supported by New York's position at the terminus of several transatlantic fibre optic lines, its intellectual capital, as well as its open-air wireless connectivity.

name: new_york
sentence: In December 2014, the State of New York announced a $50 million venture capital fund to encourage companies working in biotechnology and advanced materials; according to Governor Andrew Cuomo, seed money would help entrepreneurs put their research on the market.

name: new_york
sentence: On December 19, 2011, then Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg announced his choice of Cornell University and Technion-Israel Institute of Technology to build a $2 billion college of applied sciences on Roosevelt Island in Manhattan to transform New York into the world's first technological capital.

name: new_york
sentence: Albany, Saratoga County, Rensselaer County, and the Hudson Valley, collectively recognized as the Eastern New York Technology Valley, have experienced significant growth in high-tech computer hardware, with major advances in nanotechnology, digital electronics design, and the manufacture of microchip integrated circuits dependent on water and electricity, including companies such as IBM and its Thomas J. Watson Research Centre, as well as the three foreign companies, GlobalFoundries, Samsung and Taiwan Semiconductor.

name: new_york
sentence: The region's high-tech ecosystem is supported by technology-based academic institutions, including the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute and the SUNY Polytechnic Institute.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2015, Tech Valley, which straddles both sides of the Adirondack Northway and the New York Thruway, generated more than $163 million in venture capital investments.

name: new_york
sentence: The Rochester region is important in the field of photographic processing and imaging, as well as in the incubation of an increasingly diverse high-tech sphere encompassing STEM domains, as well as the results of private start-up companies working with major academic institutions, including the University of Rochester and Cornell University.

name: new_york
sentence: Westchester County developed a booming biotechnology sector in the 21st century, with more than $1 billion in private investment expected from 2016.

name: new_york
sentence: Creative industries, which generate and disseminate knowledge and information, such as new media, digital media, film and television production, advertising, fashion, design and architecture, account for an increasing share of employment, with the city of New York having a significant competitive advantage in these industries.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2014, the State of New York offered tax incentives of up to $420 million per year for the production of films within the state, the most generous tax rebate in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: New York also attracted higher visual effects jobs by further increasing its tax credit to a maximum of 35% for post-film production in Upstate New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The filmed entertainment industry has grown in New York, contributing nearly $9 billion to the New York economy in 2015.

name: new_york
sentence: I Love New York is a slogan, logo and state song that are the basis of an advertising campaign and has been used since 1977 to promote tourism in New York State, including New York City.

name: new_york
sentence: The brand logo belongs to the New York State Empire State Development.

name: new_york
sentence: The Broadway League reported that Broadway's programming sold approximately $1.27 billion in tickets for the 2013–14 season, an increase of 11.4% from $1.39 billion for the 2012–13 season.

name: new_york
sentence: Participation in 2013–14 was $12.21 million, an increase of 5.5% over the $11.57 million in the 2012–13 season.

name: new_york
sentence: New York exports a wide variety of products such as prepared food, computers and electronics, cut diamonds and other products.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2007, the Government exported a total of $71.1 billion of goods, with Canada ($15 billion), Switzerland ($5.9 billion), Israel ($4.9 billion) and Hong Kong ($3.4 billion) the five largest foreign export markets.

name: new_york
sentence: New York's largest imports are oil, gold, aluminum, natural gas, electricity, rough diamonds and lumber.

name: new_york
sentence: The state also has a large manufacturing sector that includes clothing printing and production, primarily in New York; and furs, railway equipment, auto parts and bus line vehicles, concentrated in Upstate areas.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is the third largest producer of grapes in the country and the second largest producer of wine, behind California.

name: new_york
sentence: The hills of South Finger Lakes, the Hudson Valley, the northern fork of Long Island and the south shore of Lake Erie are the main wine-growing and wine-growing areas of New York, with many vineyards.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2012, New York had 320 wineries and 37,000 hectares of vines, generating full-time jobs for nearly 25,000 people and annual wages over $1.1 billion, and producing $4.8 billion in direct economic impact of New York grapes, grape juice and wine and grape products.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York agricultural industry is one of the largest producers overall, ranking among the top five countries for agricultural products, including maple syrup, apples, cherries, cabbage, dairy products, onions and potatoes.

name: new_york
sentence: The state is the largest cabbage producer in the United States

name: new_york
sentence: The government owns about a quarter of its agricultural land and produced $3.4 billion in agricultural products in 2001.

name: new_york
sentence: The south shore of Lake Ontario provides the right mix of soils and microclimates for many apple orchards, cherries, plums, pears and peaches.

name: new_york
sentence: Apples are also grown in the Hudson Valley and near Lake Champlain.

name: new_york
sentence: A medium-sized commercial saltwater fishery is located along the Atlantic side of Long Island.

name: new_york
sentence: The main catches are clams, lobsters, squid and plaice.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2017, New York State consumed 156,370 gigawatt hours (GWh) of electrical energy.

name: new_york
sentence: Lower-state regions (Hudson Valley, New York and Long Island) consumed 66% of this amount.

name: new_york
sentence: The outermost regions produced 50% of this amount.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2017, the maximum load was 29,699 MW.

name: new_york
sentence: Resource capacity in 2017 was 42,839 MW.

name: new_york
sentence: The NYISO market monitor described the overall average electricity price as a range (a single value was not provided) from $25 per MWh to $53 per MWh for 2017.

name: new_york
sentence: At the post-secondary level, the state's public university system is the State University of New York (SUNY).

name: new_york
sentence: SUNY consists of 64 community colleges, technical colleges, undergraduate colleges and doctoral institutions, including several universities.

name: new_york
sentence: New York's flagship university is Buffalo University, founded by U.S. President Billard Fillmore.

name: new_york
sentence: Along with Buffalo University, Binghamton University also ranks high in the rankings of the best public universities in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: New York City has its own City University of New York (CUNY) system, which is funded by the city.

name: new_york
sentence: Columbia University, Cornell University and New York University are among the largest higher education institutions in New York, all world-renowned private universities and members of the Association of American Universities, the first group of research universities in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: Other major private universities include Syracuse University and Fordham University.

name: new_york
sentence: The smallest private institutions of higher education are Rockefeller University, Mercy College, New York Institute of Technology, Rensselaer Polytechnic, Yeshiva University and Hofstra University.

name: new_york
sentence: There are also a multitude of postgraduate schools in New York State, including schools of medicine, law and engineering.

name: new_york
sentence: The U.S. Army Service Academy, West Point, is located just south of Newburgh, on the west bank of the Hudson River.

name: new_york
sentence: The Federal Merchant Navy Academy is located at Kings Point on Long Island.

name: new_york
sentence: A number of private, selective liberal arts establishments are located in New York.

name: new_york
sentence: These include Bard College, Barnard College, Colgate University, Hamilton College, Hobart and William Smith Colleges, Marist College, Sarah Lawrence College, Skidmore College, Union College and Vassar College.

name: new_york
sentence: Two of these schools, Barnard and Vassar, are members of the Seven Sisters elite, all originally female schools with links to the Ivy League.

name: new_york
sentence: Barnard was affiliated with Columbia University, its neighbour in Manhattan, and Vassar became a co-educator in 1969 after declining a merger offer with Yale University.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is also home to what is widely regarded as the best performing arts school in the world.

name: new_york
sentence: The Juilliard School, located in Manhattan's Upper West Side, is one of the world's leading music and dance schools.

name: new_york
sentence: The Eastman School of Music, a professional school at the University of Rochester, was ranked first among American music schools by US News & World Report for five consecutive years.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York State University accredits and establishes standards for primary, middle and secondary education in the State, while the New York State Department of Education supervises public schools and monitors their standardized examinations.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York Department of Education operates the New York Public Schools system.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1894, reflecting general racial discrimination, the State passed a law allowing communities to establish separate schools for children of African-American descent.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1900, the state passed another law requiring integrated schools.

name: new_york
sentence: In fiscal year 2013, New York spent more money on public education per student than any other state, according to U.S. Census Bureau statistics.

name: new_york
sentence: New York has one of the largest and oldest transportation infrastructure in the country.

name: new_york
sentence: The engineering problems posed by the complex terrain of the state and the unique infrastructure problems of the city of New York, caused by urban congestion, had to be overcome on a permanent basis.

name: new_york
sentence: The population expansion of the state followed the trail of the first waterways, first the Hudson River and the Mohawk River, and then the Erie Canal.

name: new_york
sentence: In the 19th century, railways were built along river valleys, followed by the New York State Thruway in the 20th century.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York State Department of Transport (NYSDOT) is the New York Government Department responsible for the establishment and operation of roads, railways, public transport systems, ports, waterways and air facilities in New York State.

name: new_york
sentence: The NYSDOT head office is located at 50 Wolf Road, Colonie, Albany County.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York and New Jersey Port Authority (PANYNJ) is a joint venture between the states of New York and New Jersey and authorized by the American Congress, established in 1921 through an inter-State pact, which oversees much of the regional transportation infrastructure, including bridges, tunnels, airports and seaports, within the geographic jurisdiction of the port of New York and New Jersey.

name: new_york
sentence: This 1,500-square-mile port area (3,900 km2) is generally covered within a 25-mile radius (40 km) of the National Monument of the Statue of Liberty.

name: new_york
sentence: The Harbour Authority's headquarters are located at the 4 World Trade Center in Lower Manhattan.

name: new_york
sentence: In addition to the well-known New York Metro system, which is confined to the city of New York, four suburban rail networks enter and exit the city: the Long Island Railway, the Metro-North Railway, the Trans-Hudson Port Authority and five of New Jersey Transit's railway lines.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York City Department of Transportation (NYCDOT) is the New York City government agency responsible for managing much of New York's transportation infrastructure.

name: new_york
sentence: Other cities in New York have urban and regional public transport.

name: new_york
sentence: In Buffalo, the Niagara Frontier Transportation Authority manages Buffalo Metro Rail's light rail system; in Rochester, Rochester Metro operated from 1927 to 1956, but became obsolete as the state and the federal government invested in highways.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York State Motor Vehicle Department (NYSDMV or DMV) is the government agency responsible for registering and inspecting motor vehicles and other motor vehicles, as well as authorizing drivers in New York State.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2008, NYSDMV had 11,284,546 driving licences and 10,697,644 vehicle registrations in force.

name: new_york
sentence: All gasoline vehicles registered in New York State must be inspected for emissions every 12 months to ensure that environmental quality controls prevent air pollution.

name: new_york
sentence: Diesel-powered vehicles with a gross mass of more than 8,500 pounds registered in most counties of Downstate New York are subject to an annual emission inspection.

name: new_york
sentence: All vehicles registered in New York State shall be subject to an annual safety inspection.

name: new_york
sentence: Portions of the transport system are intermodal, allowing passengers to easily move from one mode of transport to another.

name: new_york
sentence: One of the most notable examples is AirTrain JFK, which allows rail passengers to travel directly to the John F. Kennedy International Airport terminals and to the New York Underground Metro.

name: new_york
sentence: The Government of New York embodies the Government structure of the State of New York established by the Constitution of the State of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: It is composed of three branches: executive, legislative and judicial.

name: new_york
sentence: The Governor is the Head of State Administration and is assisted by the Lieutenant Governor.

name: new_york
sentence: Both are elected on the same ticket.

name: new_york
sentence: Other elected officials include the Attorney General and the Comptroller.

name: new_york
sentence: The Secretary of State, a former elected member, is currently appointed by the Governor.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York State Legislative Assembly is bicameral and consists of the New York State Senator and the New York State Assembly.

name: new_york
sentence: The Assembly is composed of 150 members, while the Senate varies in its membership, which currently has 63 members.

name: new_york
sentence: The legislature is empowered to make laws, subject to the Governor's power to veto a bill.

name: new_york
sentence: However, the right of veto may be exceeded by the legislator if there is a two-thirds majority in favour of exceeding each chamber.

name: new_york
sentence: Permanent laws of a general nature are codified in the unified laws of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The highest court of appeal in the unified judicial system is the Court of Appeal, while the first court of first instance is the County Court (or the Supreme Court in New York).

name: new_york
sentence: The Supreme Court also acts as an intermediate court of appeal for many cases, and local courts deal with a variety of other issues, including small disputes, contraventions and local zoning issues, and are the starting point for all criminal cases.

name: new_york
sentence: The City of New York Courts are the largest system of local courts.

name: new_york
sentence: The State is divided into counties, cities, towns and villages, all of which are municipal corporations vis-à-vis their own governments, as well as various corporations that serve for single purposes that are also local governments, such as school districts, fire districts and public utility corporations in New York State, often known as development authorities or corporations.

name: new_york
sentence: Each municipal corporation is given different home government powers, as provided for in the New York Constitution.

name: new_york
sentence: The state also has 10 Indian reserves.

name: new_york
sentence: There have been several movements regarding the secession of the State of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: Proposals include a State of Long Island, composed of everything on the island outside New York; a State called Niagara, the counties of western New York State; the counties of northern New York State called Upstate New York; making New York City a State; a proposal for a new County of Peconic in eastern Long Island; and for the borough of Staten Island to leave New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The death penalty was reintroduced in 1995 under the Pataki administration, but the law was declared unconstitutional in 2004, when the New York Court of Appeal ruled in People v. LaValle that it violated the constitution of the State.

name: new_york
sentence: The remaining death penalty was commuted by the court to life imprisonment in 2007, in People v. John Taylor, and death row was dissolved in 2008, pursuant to an order made by Governor David Paterson.

name: new_york
sentence: No executions have taken place in New York since 1963.

name: new_york
sentence: Legislative efforts to amend the law had failed, and the death penalty was no longer required at the state level, although certain crimes falling within the jurisdiction of the federal government were punishable by the federal death penalty.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is represented by Chuck Schumer and Kirsten Gillibrand in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: There are 27 congress districts, the third largest number of congress districts in the country, equal to Florida and behind California's 53 and 36.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2019, 21 districts were represented by members of the Democratic Party, and 6 were represented by Republicans.

name: new_york
sentence: Representation was reduced from 29 in 2013 due to the slowdown in the overall population growth of the State compared to the overall national population growth.

name: new_york
sentence: New York had 29 votes in the national presidential elections, down from its 47-vote summit from 1933 to 1953.

name: new_york
sentence: The state has a significant imbalance in payments with the federal government.

name: new_york
sentence: According to the New York State Comptroller's Office, New York received 91 cents of services for every dollar it sent to the U.S. federal government in fiscal year 2013; New York ranked 46th in the federal balance of payments to the state on a per capita basis.

name: new_york
sentence: In April 2016, Democrats represented a plurality of voters in New York State, representing more than twice as many registered voters as any other affiliation or absence of a political party.

name: new_york
sentence: Since the second half of the twentieth century, New York has generally supported Democratic Party candidates in national elections.

name: new_york
sentence: Democratic presidential candidate Barack Obama won the state of New York by more than 25 percentage points in 2012 and 2008.

name: new_york
sentence: New York, along with other major cities in the state, including Albany, Buffalo, Rochester, Yonkers and Syracuse, are important democratic strongholds, with liberal politics.

name: new_york
sentence: However, the rural areas of New York are generally more conservative than cities and tend to favour Republicans.

name: new_york
sentence: Suburban, densely populated areas, such as Westchester County and Long Island, have crossed the major parties since the 1980s, but most often they support the Democrats.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is the largest source of political fund-raising in the United States for the two main parties.

name: new_york
sentence: Four of the nation's top five zip codes for political contributions are in Manhattan.

name: new_york
sentence: The top postal code, 10021 on the Upper East Side, generated the most money for the 2000 presidential campaigns of George W. Bush and Al Gore.

name: new_york
sentence: The State of New York has the distinction of being the State of origin of the two main parties designated in three presidential elections.

name: new_york
sentence: The 1904 presidential election saw former New York Governor and outgoing President Theodore Roosevelt face Alton B. Parker, Chief Justice of the New York Court of Appeal.

name: new_york
sentence: The 1944 presidential election had Franklin D. Roosevelt, following in the footsteps of his cousin Theodore as former governor of New York and outgoing president for re-election against the current governor of New York Thomas E. Dewey.

name: new_york
sentence: In the 2016 presidential election, the former U.S. Senator of New York Hillary Clinton, a resident of Chappaqua, was the Democratic Party candidate.

name: new_york
sentence: The Republican Party candidate was businessman Donald Trump, a Manhattan resident and a Queens native.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is an important centre of international diplomacy.

name: new_york
sentence: United Nations Headquarters has been located in the eastern part of Midtown Manhattan since 1952.

name: new_york
sentence: The state of New York is geographically home to a National Football League team, the Buffalo Bills, based in the Buffalo suburb of Orchard Park.

name: new_york
sentence: Although the New York Giants and the New York Jets represent the New York metropolitan area and were previously located in New York City, they play in MetLife Stadium, located in East Rutherford, New Jersey.

name: new_york
sentence: New York also has two Major League baseball teams, the New York Yankees (based in the Bronx) and the New York Mets (based in the Queens).

name: new_york
sentence: Minor league baseball teams also play in New York State, including the Long Island Ducks, Brooklyn Cyclones and Staten Island Yankees, as well as Rochester Red Wings, Binghamton Rumble Ponies, Syracuse Mets, Auburn Doubledays, Batavia Muckdogs, Hudson Valley Renegades and Buffalo Bisons.

name: new_york
sentence: New York has three National Hockey League franchises: the New York Rangers in Manhattan, the New York Islanders in Brooklyn and Nassau County in Long Island, and the Buffalo Sabres.

name: new_york
sentence: New York has two teams from the National Basketball Association, the New York Knicks in Manhattan and the Brooklyn Nets in Brooklyn.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is the seat of a major league football franchise, New York City FC, which currently plays in the Bronx.

name: new_york
sentence: Although the New York Red Bull represent the New York metropolitan area, they play Red Bull Arena in Harrison, New Jersey.

name: new_york
sentence: New York hosts the 1932 and 1980 Olympic Winter Games at Placid Lake.

name: new_york
sentence: The 1980 Games are known for the US-US ice hockey game known as the Miracle on Ice, during which a group of American students and amateurs defeated the highly favoured Soviet 4–3 national ice hockey team and won the gold medal against Finland.

name: new_york
sentence: With St. Moritz, Switzerland and Innsbruck, Austria, Lake Placid is one of three cities to have hosted the Olympic Winter Games twice.

name: new_york
sentence: New York City bid for the 2012 Summer Olympics but lost to London.

name: new_york
sentence: Several national sports halls in the United States are or have been located in New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum is located in Cooperstown, Otsego County.

name: new_york
sentence: The National Race and Hall of Fame Museum in Saratoga Springs, Saratoga County, honours achievements in the sport of pure-bred horse racing.

name: new_york
sentence: The physical installation of the National Soccer Hall of Fame in Oneonta, also in Otsego County, closed in 2010, although the organization itself continued its inductions.

name: new_york
sentence: The annual open tennis championship in the United States is one of four Grand Slam tennis tournaments in the world and is held at the National Tennis Center in Flushing Meadows–Corona Park, Queens District, New York.

name: new_york
sentence: New York State also hosts many Division 1 intercollegial sports programs.

name: new_york
sentence: The flagship university at the State University of New York in Buffalo is the Buffalo Bulls.

name: new_york
sentence: The inter-college teams at Syracuse University are the Orange Syracuse.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina is a state located in the southeastern part of the United States.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina is the 28th largest and 9th most populous of the 50 United States.

name: north_carolina

sentence: Since the 1970s, North Carolina has seen a steady increase in population growth.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina is bordered by South Carolina to the south, Georgia to the southwest, Tennessee to the west, Virginia to the north, and the Atlantic Ocean to the east.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The United States Census Bureau places North Carolina in the South Atlantic Division of the South Region.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina consists of three major geographic areas: the Atlantic coastal plain, which occupies the eastern part of the state, the central Piedmont region, and the western mountainous region, which is part of the Appalachians.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The coastal plain consists of more specifically defined areas such as the outer shores, a chain of sandy and narrow islands separated from the continent by sounds or inlets, including the Albemarle Strait and Pamlico Strait, the tidal waters region, the home of the venous flyer and the inland coastal plain, where long-leaved pines are native.

name: north_carolina
sentence: So many ships have been lost off Cape Hatteras that the region is known as the "Atlantic Caveyard"; more than a thousand ships have sunk in these waters since the records began in 1526.

sentence: The most famous of them is the revenge of Queen Anne (flagship of Black Barbe pirate), who ran aground at Beaufort Inlet in 1718.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The coastal plain passes to the Piedmont region along the autumn line of the Atlantic coast, the altitude at which waterfalls first appear on rivers and streams.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The Piedmont region of central North Carolina is the most populated area of the state, which contains the six largest cities in the state by population.

name: north_carolina
sentence: It consists of a gently sloping country often broken by hills or low mountain ridges.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Small, isolated and deeply eroded mountain ranges and peaks are located in Piedmont, including the Sauratown Mountains, Pilot Mountain, Uwharrie Mountains, Crowder's Mountain, King's Pinnacle Mountains, Brossy Mountains and the South Mountains.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The Piedmont extends from about 91 metres to the east to about 460 metres to the west.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The western part of the state is part of the Appalachian range.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Among the sub-ranges of the Appalachians located in the state are the Smoky Mountains, Blue Ridge Mountains and Black Mountains.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The Black Mountains are the highest in the eastern United States and peak at Mount Mitchell at 2,037 metres, the highest point east of Mississippi.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina has 17 main watersheds.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The five basins west of the Blue Ridge Mountains flow to the Gulf of Mexico, while the remainder flow to the Atlantic Ocean.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Of the 17 basins, 11 are from the state of North Carolina, but only four are located entirely within the state border: Cap Peur, Neuse, White Oak and Tar-Pamlico Basin.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Elevation above sea level is the main cause of temperature change across the state, the mountainous region being the coldest all year round.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The climate is also influenced by the Atlantic Ocean and the Gulf Stream, particularly in the coastal plain.

name: north_carolina
sentence: These influences tend to cause warmer winter temperatures along the coast, where temperatures only sometimes fall below freezing at night.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The coastal plain has an average of about 2.5 cm of snow or ice per year, and there may be no snow or ice for many years.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The Atlantic Ocean has less influence on the climate of the Piedmont region, which has warmer summers and colder winters than along the coast, although the average daily maximum is still less than 90°F (32°C) in most locations.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina is experiencing severe weather both in summer and winter, with the threat of hurricanes, tropical storms, heavy rains and floods.

sentence: Hurricane Isabel is the most destructive of the 21st century.

name: north_carolina

name: north_carolina
sentence: Since the comfortable victory of Southern Democrat Jimmy Carter in the state in 1976, the state had always leaned Republican in the presidential elections until Democratic Barack Obama won the state closely in 2008.

sentence: The historic sites of the regions are connected by the Albemarle Historical Tower.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina offers a wide range of recreational activities, from swimming to the beach to skiing in the mountains.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina offers autumn colours, freshwater and saltwater fishing, hunting, bird watching, agrotourism, mountain biking trails, hot air ballooning, climbing, cycling, hiking, skiing, navigation and sailing, camping, canoeing, gardens and arboretums.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina has amusement parks, aquariums, museums, historic sites, lighthouses, elegant theatres, concert halls and refined restaurants.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Northern Carolinians enjoy outdoor recreation using numerous local bike paths, 34 state parks and 14 national parks.

name: north_carolina
sentence: National Park Service Units include the Appalachian National Scenic Trail, Blue Ridge Drive, Cape Hatteras National Seashore, Cape Lookout National Seashore, Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site in Flat Rock, Fort Raleigh National Historic Site in Manteo, Smoky Great Mountains National Park, Guilford Courthouse National Military Park in Greensboro, Moores Creek National Battlefield near Currie in Pender County, Overmountain Victory National Historic Site, Old Salem National Historic Site in Winston-Salem, Tears National Historic Trail and Wright Brothers National Memorial in Kill Devil Hills.

name: north_carolina
sentence: National forests include the Uwharrie National Forest in central North Carolina, the Croatian National Forest in eastern North Carolina, the Pisgah National Forest in the western mountains, and the Nantahala National Forest in the southwestern part of the state.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina has traditions in art, music, and cooking.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The not-for-profit arts and culture industry generates $1.2 billion in direct economic activity in North Carolina, supporting over 43,600 full-time equivalent jobs and generating $119 million in revenues for local governments and the state of North Carolina.

name: north_carolina

name: north_carolina
sentence: See also this list of museums in North Carolina.

name: north_carolina
sentence: One of the most famous arts communities in the state is Seagrove, the capital of the artisan pottery of the United States, where artisans create artisan pottery inspired by the same traditions that began in this community more than two hundred years ago.

name: north_carolina

sentence: Metal and punk, such as Corrosion of Conformity, Between the Buried and Me, and Nightmare Sonata, are native to North Carolina.

Fletcher Opera Institute of the University of North Carolina School of the Arts in Winston-Salem, the Department of Music at the University of North Carolina in Chapel Hill, and the UNC Greensboro.

name: north_carolina
sentence: A North Carolina basic food is a pork barbecue.

sentence: There are strong regional differences and rivalries on the sauces and methods used to make the barbecue.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The common trend in western North Carolina is the use of top quality Boston buttocks.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Western North Carolina barbecue is commonly referred to as Lexington BBQ after the town of Lexington Piedmont Triad, the home of the Lexington Barbecue Festival, which attracts more than 100,000 visitors each October.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The pork barbecue in North Carolina uses vinegar and red pepper sauce and the "whole pig" is cooked, incorporating both white and dark meat.

sentence: Krispy Kreme, an international donut shop chain, was founded in North Carolina; the company's head office is in Winston-Salem.

sentence: Recognized and marketed beer brands in North Carolina include Highland Brewing, Duck Rabbit Brewery, Mother Earth Brewery, Weeping Radish Brewery, Big Boss Brewing, Foothills Brewing, Carolina Brewing Company, Lonerider Brewing and White Rabbit Brewing Company.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina has extensive grazing areas for beef and dairy cattle.

sentence: There are truck farms in North Carolina.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The government's shipping, commercial fishing and softwood lumber industry is important to its economy.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Research Triangle Park, a large industrial complex located in the Raleigh-Durham region, is one of the country's major centres for electronics and medical research.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Tobacco is one of the first major industries to develop after the civil war.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Many farmers cultivated tobacco, and the invention of cigarettes made the product particularly popular.

name: north_carolina
sentence: In 1914, it sold 425 million packages of Camel per year.

sentence: RJR is an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of Reynolds American Inc., which in turn is 42% owned by British American Tobacco.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Several ships have been named after the state, the most famous of the United States in North Carolina in the Pacific Ocean theatre of the Second World War.

sentence: Now disused, she is part of the USNorth Carolina Battleship Memorial in Wilmington.

sentence: Another U.S. North Carolina nuclear attack submarine was commissioned in Wilmington on May 3, 2008.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The Crown maintains a group of protected areas, known as the North Carolina State Park System, which is managed by the North Carolina Division of Parks & Recreation (NCDPR), an agency of the North Carolina Department of Environment and Natural Resources (NCDENR).

name: north_carolina
sentence: Fort Bragg, near Fayetteville and Southern Pines, is a large, comprehensive military base and headquarters of the 18th Airborne Corps, the 82nd Airborne Division and the Special Operations Command of the United States Army.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The air wing of Fort Bragg is Pope Field, also located near Fayetteville.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Located in Jacksonville, Marine Corps Base Camp Lejeune, combined with nearby bases Marine Corps Air Station (MCAS) Cherry Point, MCAS New River, Camp Geiger, Camp Johnson, Stone Bay and Courthouse Bay, is the largest concentration of Marines and sailors in the world.

sentence: MCAS Cherry Point is the headquarters of 2 Wing Marine Aircraft.

sentence: Located in Goldsboro, Seymour Johnson Air Base is home to 4 Wing Fighters and 916 Wing Air Refuelling.

sentence: One of the busiest U.S. Coast Guard air stations is located at the Elizabeth City Coast Guard Air Station.

sentence: Also stationed in North Carolina is the military terminal of the Sunny Point Ocean in Southport.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota is a state in the Midwest of the United States.

name: north_dakota
sentence: It bears the names of the indigenous tribes Lakota and Dakota Sioux, which make up a large part of the population and historically dominate the territory.

name: north_dakota
sentence: It is the nineteenth largest in the region, the fourth least populated, and the fourth least populated of the 50 States.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Its capital is Bismarck, and its largest city is Fargo.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota was admitted to the Union on 2 November 1889, with its neighbouring state, South Dakota.

name: north_dakota
sentence: They were the 39th and 40th States admitted to union.

name: north_dakota
sentence: President Benjamin Harrison modified the state documents before signing them so that no one would know who became a state first.

name: north_dakota
sentence: For convenience, both states are numbered in alphabetical order.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In the 21st century, the natural resources of North Dakota played a major role in its economic performance, particularly with the extraction of oil from the Bakken Formation, located under the northwestern part of the state.

name: north_dakota
sentence: This has led to population growth and a reduction in unemployment, leading North Dakota to the second lowest unemployment rate in the country (after Hawaii).

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota is home to the highest man-made structure in the western hemisphere, the KVLY-TV mast.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota is located in the Upper Midwest of the United States.

name: north_dakota
sentence: It is located in the centre of the North American continent and borders Canada to the north.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The geographic centre of North America is near the city of Center.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Bismarck is the capital of North Dakota, and Fargo is the largest city in the country.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Soil is the most valuable resource in North Dakota.

name: north_dakota
sentence: It is the foundation of the state's great agricultural wealth.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota also has huge mineral resources.

name: north_dakota
sentence: These mineral resources include billions of tons of lignite coal.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In addition, North Dakota has significant oil reserves.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Oil was discovered in the state in 1951 and quickly became one of the most valuable mineral resources in North Dakota.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In the early 2000s, the emergence of hydraulic fracturing technologies allowed mining companies to extract huge amounts of oil from the formation of Bakken shale rocks in the western part of the state.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The North Dakota economy relies more heavily on agriculture than most other states.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Many North Dakota plants manufacture agricultural products or agricultural equipment.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Many state merchants also depend on agriculture.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Farms and ranches cover almost all areas of North Dakota.

name: north_dakota
sentence: They stretch from the flat valley of the Red River to the east, through the hilly plains, to the rugged Badlands to the west.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The main crop, wheat, is grown in almost all counties.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota harvests more than 90 per cent of the canola and flaxseed of the nation.

name: north_dakota
sentence: It is also the largest domestic producer of barley and sunflower seeds and a leader in the production of beans, honey, lentils, oats, peas and sugar beets.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Few white settlers came to the North Dakota region before the 1870s because the railways had not yet entered the area.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In the early 1870s, the North Pacific Railway began to cross Dakota territory.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Large-scale agriculture also began in the 1870s.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Eastern societies and some families have established huge wheat farms covering large areas in the Red River Valley.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The farms made huge profits that they were called Bonanza Farms.

name: north_dakota
sentence: White settlers, attracted by the success of Bonanza farms, flocked to North Dakota, rapidly increasing the territory's population.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In 1870, there were 2,405 people in North Dakota.

name: north_dakota
sentence: By 1890, the population had increased to 190,983.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota was named for the Sioux who once lived in the territory.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The Sioux were called Dakota or Lakota, which means allies or friends.

name: north_dakota
sentence: One of the nicknames of North Dakota is the State of the Garden of Peace.

name: north_dakota
sentence: This nickname pays tribute to the International Garden of Peace, located on the state border with Manitoba, in Canada.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota is also called the state of Flickr because of the numerous land squirrels (Richardson land squirrels) that live in the central part of the state.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota is located in the United States region known as Great Plains.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The state shares the Northern Red River with Minnesota in the east.

name: north_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is located to the south, Montana to the west and the Canadian provinces of Saskatchewan and Manitoba to the north.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota is located near the centre of North America, with a stone marker in Rugby, North Dakota, which marks the "Geographic Centre of the North American Continent".

name: north_dakota
sentence: With an area of 70,762 square miles (183,273 km2), of which 178,712 square kilometres are land, North Dakota is the 19th largest state.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The western half of the state consists of the hilly Great Plains and the northern part of the Badlands, which are west of the Missouri River.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The highest point of the state, White Butte at 3506 feet (1,069 m), and Theodore Roosevelt National Park are in the Badlands.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The region is abundant in fossil fuels, including natural gas, crude oil and lignite coal.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The Missouri River forms Lake Sakakawea, the third largest artificial lake in the United States, behind the Garrison Dam.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The central region of the state is divided between the Drift Prairie and the Missouri Plateau.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The eastern part of the state consists of the flat valley of the Red River, the bottom of Ice Lake Agassiz.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Its fertile soil, drained by the meander of the Red River flowing north into Lake Winnipeg, supports a major agricultural industry.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Devils Lake, the largest natural lake in the state, is also to the east.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Most of the state is covered by grasslands

name: north_dakota
sentence: Natural trees are usually found in North Dakota where there is good drainage, such as the ravines and valley near Pembina Gorge and Killdeer Mountains, Turtle Mountains, the hills around Devil Lake, in the McHenry County dune area in central North Dakota, and along the slopes of the Sheyenne Valley and Sheyenne Delta.

name: north_dakota
sentence: This diverse land supports nearly 2,000 species of plants.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota has a continental climate, with warm summers and cold winters.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Temperature differences are significant due to its remote interior position and being in the centre of the Northern Hemisphere, with approximately equal distances with the North Pole and the equator.

name: north_dakota
sentence: American Aboriginal peoples have lived in what is now North Dakota for thousands of years before the arrival of Europeans.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The known tribes included the Mandan people (around the 11th century), while the first Hidatsa group arrived a few hundred years later.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Both gathered in villages on the tributaries of the Missouri River in what would become the western centre of North Dakota.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Crow Indians travelled to the western plains to visit and trade with related Hidatas after the split between them, probably in the 17th century.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Later came the divisions of the Dakota people — Lakota, Santee and Yanktonai.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The Assiniboine and the Crees of the Plains made journeys southward to the Indians of the village, either for trade or for war.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The Shoshone Indians of Wyoming and Montana today may have carried out attacks on Indian enemies as far east as Missouri.

name: north_dakota
sentence: A group of Cheyennes lived in a village of land houses at the lower Sheyenne River (site Biesterfeldt) for decades in the 18th century.

name: north_dakota
sentence: As a result of attacks by the Cree, Assiniboine and Chippewas armed with firearms, they left the area around 1780 and crossed Missouri some time later.

name: north_dakota
sentence: A band of the few Sotaio Indians lived east of Missouri and met the uprooted Cheyennes before the end of the century.

name: north_dakota
sentence: They soon followed the Cheyennes through Missouri and lived among them south of Cannonball River.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Finally, the Cheyennes and the Sutaio became a tribe and turned into buffalo hunters with ranges mainly outside North Dakota.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Before the middle of the 19th century, Arikara entered the future state of the south and joined Mandan and Hidatsa.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Over time, a number of Indians signed treaties with the United States.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Many of the treaties defined the territory of a particular tribe (see map).

name: north_dakota
sentence: The first European to reach the region was the French-Canadian merchant Pierre Gaultier, Sieur de La Vérendrye, who led a part of exploration and trade in the villages of Mandan in 1738.

name: north_dakota
sentence: From 1762 to 1802, this region was part of the Spanish Louisiana.

name: north_dakota
sentence: American Europeans only settled in Dakota until the end of the 19th century, when railways opened the area.

name: north_dakota
sentence: With the advantage of land concessions, they vigorously market their properties, exalting the region as the ideal for agriculture.

name: north_dakota
sentence: On February 22, 1889, Congress passed an omnibus bill for North Dakota, South Dakota, Montana and Washington, entitled The Enabling Act of 1889, under the administration of President Grover Cleveland.

name: north_dakota
sentence: His successor, Benjamin Harrison, signed the proclamations that officially admitted North Dakota and South Dakota to the Union on November 2, 1889.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The rivalry between the two new states presented a dilemma that must first be admitted to exist.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Harrison ordered Secretary of State James G. Blaine to mix the papers and obscure it that he had signed first.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The actual order was not recorded, so no one knows which Dakotas were admitted first.

name: north_dakota
sentence: However, since North Dakota appears alphabetically before South Dakota, its proclamation was first published in the At Large Statutes.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The carelessness among wheat producers, especially among Norwegian immigrants, led to a populist political movement centered in the non-partisan League ("NPL") around the First World War.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The NPL presented candidates on the Republican ticket (but merged with the Democratic Party after the Second World War).

name: north_dakota
sentence: He tried to isolate North Dakota from the power of banks and out-of-state companies.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In addition to founding the Bank of North Dakota and North Dakota Mill and Elevator (both are still in place), NPL established a state railway line (later sold to Soo Line Railroad).

name: north_dakota
sentence: Anti-corporation laws virtually prohibited a corporation or bank from owning title to land delimited as agricultural land.

name: north_dakota
sentence: These laws, still in force today, after being confirmed by the state and federal courts, make it almost impossible to seize agricultural land, because even after the seizure, the title to property cannot be held by a bank or a mortgage company.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In addition, the North Dakota Bank, with powers similar to those of a federal reserve branch bank, exercised its power to limit the issuance of sub-prime mortgages and their guarantee in the form of derivative instruments, thereby preventing the collapse of housing prices in the state following the 2008 financial crisis.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The original Capitol of the State of North Dakota at Bismarck burned on the ground on December 28, 1930.

name: north_dakota
sentence: It was replaced by an art deco skyscraper with limestone facets that still stands today.

name: north_dakota
sentence: A series of federal investment and construction projects began in the 1950s, including the garrison dam and the Minot and Grand Forks Air Force bases.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Western North Dakota experienced a boom in oil exploration in the late 1970s and early 1980s, with rising oil prices making development profitable.

name: north_dakota
sentence: This boom ended after the fall in oil prices.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In recent years, the State has registered unemployment rates below the national average and has increased employment and population growth.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Much of the growth was based on the development of Bakken's oil fields in the western part of the state.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Estimates of the remaining amount of oil in the region vary, some of which are estimated to be over 100 years old.

name: north_dakota
sentence: For decades, the annual North Dakota murder rate and violent crime rate were consistently lowest in the United States.

name: north_dakota
sentence: However, in recent years, although still below the national average, crime has increased sharply.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In 2016, the violent crime rate was three times higher than in 2004, and the increase occurred mainly in the late 2000s, coinciding with the oil boom era.

name: north_dakota
sentence: This happened at a time when the national violent crime rate fell slightly.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Workers in oil boom cities were accused of much of the increase.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the North Dakota population was 762,062 as of July 1, 2019, an increase of 13.30 per cent over the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: north_dakota
sentence: This makes North Dakota the state of the United States with the highest percentage of population growth since 2011.

name: north_dakota
sentence: North Dakota is the fourth least populated state in the country; only Alaska, Vermont and Wyoming have fewer residents.

name: north_dakota
sentence: With less than 2,000 people in 1870, the North Dakota population increased to nearly 680,000 in 1930.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Growth has then slowed and the population has fluctuated slightly over the last seven decades, reaching 617,761 at the 1970 census, compared to 642,200 at the 2000 census.

name: north_dakota
sentence: With the exception of Amerindians, the North Dakota population has a lower percentage of minorities than in the country as a whole.

name: north_dakota
sentence: In 2011, 20.7 per cent of the population of North Dakota under 1 years of age were minorities.

name: north_dakota
sentence: The North Dakota Population Centre is located in Wells County, near Sykeston.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Note: Births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnic origin and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: north_dakota
sentence: Throughout the second half of the 19th century and until the beginning of the 20th century, North Dakota, with most of the Midwest, experienced a massive influx of newcomers from the eastern United States and immigrants from Europe.

name: north_dakota

sentence: At the state level, the government has been held by the Republican Party since 1992, along with the majority of deputies and state officials.
